Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Pxxx T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute delight. Great rooms, fantastic food at rooftop restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: meg g
Reviews.Content: Last minute stay at the Hotel Isa - did not know anything about it until we walked in the door and were truly delighted with what we found. A contemporary, boutique hotel near the Vatican, it was extremely clean and comfortable. An added treat was the fantastic breakfast buffet served on the terrace. This place is a find!

Reviews.Title: “sightseeing in Rome”
Reviews.Author: longordo
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the ISA hotel.It was very clean and the staff very courteous.We booked 2 rooms and upgraded both to Superior rooms.On arrival the rooms were very different in size, one was very big and spacious and the other although comfortable, very small compared to the first room. The hotel is ideally situated for all the sights some just a short walk ie:Vatican and most of the others just a short taxi ride.There were lots of nice restaurants in the area,we ate out the 1st night then ate in the hotel restaurant the 2nd night it was so good food & the service we ate there the 3rd night too and lovely view of the Vatican from the restaurant window. We aere dissappointed however that there were no tea or coffee making facilities in the rooms which I feel is a must. I would stay here again but I would be sure to get the bigger rooms which are situated at the end of the corridors,we had a very enjoyable weekend but it wasn't perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great meals and a contributed to a wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: br73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend for five days. We loved the feel of the hotel, it had a lovely log fire downstairs and the hotel was very modern, yet had a lot of character. We found it took us about ten minutes tobwalk to the vatican (which you can see from the rooftop at breakfast? And about 15 minutes to walk to central rome. We'd never been to rome before and decided to spend more and get a superior room and we loved it- it was large with lots of space, a lovely double bed, settee and large shower. It was worth the extra money. The breakfasts were great and the chef even made omlettes aswel which was lovely. The staff were helpful and helped print off our boarding passes and booked our taxi etc. The staff provided us with a free evening meal worth €32 each- in which the chef gave us bread, antipasto buffet, pasta, steak/fish,melon and pineapple,panna cotta and also chocolate cake. Overall it was excellent and i would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Little gem.”
Reviews.Author: LeeBKHerts
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here three times, each time in a different floor with a different theme. The last time it was modern luxury we couldn't believe our luck. Rooms are comfortable and clean, we had a jacuzzi bath in the room with a huge shower in the bathroom, lush. Breakfast is up on the roof terrace now and is plentiful. Great views up here across the roof tops of Rome. This hotel is is the best location for a short ten minute walk to the stunning St Peters basilica. The city is of a size that you can walk around with a good map supplied by the hotel. Shopping is good with lots of little boutiques along the way but you come to Rome for the history and landmarks. Great restaurants nearby and the bus terminal up the road. The staff are helpful. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: hadital
Reviews.Content: Being a frequent traveller to Rome, finding a hotel to suit the budget, location and standards. always seem to be a task..but hey presto weve found it!!! The hotel is situated a stones throw from the Morrisons Irish Bar, of which we visit every year for the 6 nations rugby. Rooms were spacious, comfortable and staff very friendly. The terrace and breakfast was excellent, and having an omelette did the trick..

Reviews.Title: “Not a Value For Money (VFM) hotel”
Reviews.Author: QLXT-5_lebin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at ISA hotel during late January 2012. The location is great, safe, close to the Vatican, 8 minutes walk from the Metro station. The hotel is very small, standard rooms (euro 110 / night) are very small but this is did not bother me. Breakfast was excellent. THE TV WAS NOT WORKING and took the personnel 2 days to fix it (! i thought this would only happen in Tanzania) because... it was Sunday and they could not call the technician!! However, i did not get a discount for that. Moreover, again in Sunday I requested a personal favor that needed the manager's approval. The personnel denied to call him (since it was Sunday and the manager apparently was busy playing Play Station or whatever...) and let me wait until Monday. Silly things, NO FOCUS ON CUSTOMER. To summarize, this is a decent place to stay but NOT VALUE FOR MONEY. A price of euro 90 / night would be fair.

Reviews.Title: “SEWER GAS ODOR!!”
Reviews.Author: jpete50
Reviews.Content: I'm actually wildly ambivalent about this hotel. The good: Location, reasonably modern room and bath, very nice terrace for breakfast and cocktails, good breakfast buffet. The bad: Like another reviewer, we could not control the overheating in late December, other than by opening our window 24/7. Worse, there was a sewer-gas smell that the very nice maid finally showed us how to minimize (by placing a bath-mat over the shower drain). She also gave us to understand that the adjacent rooms on our floor, and I gathered on the lower floors, had the same problem. The front desk staff was marginally polite, but not terribly concerned about fixing the problems with heat or odor. If you consider staying in this hotel, do NOT take rooms ending in 00, 01 or 02! There are some positives; mostly the excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Looks Great from the outside but....”
Reviews.Author: Caro305
Reviews.Content: A group of 5 of us stayed at the Isa Hotel for one night from November 26 to the 27. The lobby of the hotel has been renovated and the hotel seems to be going through renovations. Unfortunately the rooms are old and the ac/heater have not been updated. When we got to the room it felt like a Sauna, since our friends were on the same floor< i went to see if they could show me how to work the thermostat. Their room was just as hot if not hotter they had their window open and were too tired to go downstatirs to the reception to ask how to work the thermostat. Temp outside was 48 F or about 8C. I decided to let it go and open my window. I did, and since my room faced Via Cicero the noise was incredible, I had to close it, went down to the reception and ask how to turn off or lower the heater. The person at the reception told me to move everything to the left and if that didn't work to move everything to the right....WTF??? Fortunately we had an early flight so we checkout at 6am. Until Isa Hotel has updated their entire system. I'm not going back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mackie55
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of November and had a brilliant time. The decor is beautifully done, both in the rooms and the public areas, buffet breakfast had an amazing choice, location is excellent for sightseeing and the staff are extremely polite and friendly, especially Willy the barman who couldn't do enough for us. The only tiny negative I can think of is that there is no drawer space in the room apart from one below the wardrobe and so a lot of our belongings such as shoes etc were on view. Apart from that, the hotel was wonderful and I would definitely recommend it. Area recommendations The area of the hotel (Via Cicerone) is excellent for sightseeing with Castel D'Angelo, Piazza Navona & the Vatican all within walking distance. What to pack We travelled in November and took mostly warm clothes with a few thinner tops. However, some days the weather was 22 degrees and we could have done with more summer clothes. At the end of the afternoon though the temperature does drop so you do end up needing a jacket/coat. Dining I would definitely recommend the Navona Notte situated on Via del Teatro Pace near to Piazza Navona. The food is excellent, staff very friendly and it is very reasonably priced. It is always full but they still manage to find you a table. We ate there several times and even tried the house carafe of wine which was lovely...

Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay-November 2011”
Reviews.Author: rhoesley
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights, the only reason it was for 5 nights is because I mistakenly prepaid. The location of the hotel was pretty good and the breakfast buffet was ok, other than that the hotel front desk staff was not that friendly, the rooms were way to small. The hotel is showing wear and tear, not a 4 star but more like a 3 star at best. They had a fire going every night and the whole hotel smelled like smoke, I told them something was wrong with their flu system because you should not have a heavy haze throughout the hotel but they did not seem to mind. Also, parking was $60 US/ night for our van, not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Isak A
Reviews.Content: Stayed here together with my fiancee from Thursday to Sunday This was our eight time in Rome together, first time stay at Hotel Isa. The location is very good, especially if you are going to the Vatican and/or shopping on foot. Just a few minutes to the Vatican or Piazza del Popolo. If your brave enough to watch a movie dubbed in italian there's a huge cinema just a minute away. The neighborhood is relatively quiet with Rome standards. We arrived with taxi because of a late night flight, but you can get here with the Metro and a few hundred meters walk as well. I see from earlier reviews and from the pictures on the website that there are some rooms that are newly refurbished and some older ones. We stayed on the second floor and both the hallway and our room looked brand new. We stayed in a superior room, more then enough space. Good size bath with plenty of towels. Comfortable beds with different pillows. There's some noise from the street in the early evening and when the city wakes up in the morning - but not disturbing during the night. Breakfast was over the ordinary in Rome with a good selection. There's also an assortment of wine/sparkling wine if you would like that for breakfast. There's a buffet / a la carte restaurant at the hotel in the evening with a small selection of dishes - fresh ingredients cooked on the spot. It was very quiet there in end of November - I guess it varies depending on the season. Very relaxing to eat at the hotel when you have walked around Rome the entire day. Both breakfast and dinner are served on the roofterrace. Even in november it's possibly to have breakfast outside - must be amazing in the summer! Check in and check out without problems. The reception and other areas on the first floor are really nice - they even used the fireplace. In short I would recommend Hotel Isa - especially if the Vatican area is your main objective.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: thefullmooney
Reviews.Content: Hi all just finishing my first trip to Rome. I booked the Hotel Isa on Via Cicerone 39 00193 Roma. Also its important to book your trips to the Vatican,Colosseum etc a good site is Viator. No queues it was great.Also pre book your travel from the airport. Terrivison was fantasic € 16.00 return to the city train station and we got the metro to Lepanto on the A line and 5/10 min your at the Hotel. €4.00 per Adult all day ticket great value. Hotel is great food wonderful.Before you set off on your trip breakfast on roof terrace is fantasic. If i hear anyone saying they did not have something for them "strange" because there buffett is one of the best. Also they have an evening buffet which is grat value and great view of the vatican lite up.Another tip buy the book Rome and the vatican good value at €7.00 and your set up. Have a great trip my fellow travelers hope i was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: roymark2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and I would recommend it as a tourist hotel. It is close to the vatican and other major tourist sites in a relatively quite are (for Rome that is). The hotel has a nice roof restaurant and bar with plenty of seating. The room was spacious and well set out with a modern and clean bathroom. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe the pictures...”
Reviews.Author: Renegade_7171
Reviews.Content: As my wife and I were going to Rome, none of us had been there before, I found this Hotel which looked awesome when looking at the pictures. When we arrived, the reception area was great but when we saw the room we were both horrified. Not even our luggage would fit even less the two of us as well. Panicing I asked the front deal for a better room, asking for the rooms on the pictures. We were shown a room which was just as horrible, but finally we managed to get a room that was great and what you expect based on their profiling and the standard stated. Breakfast was good! If you consider staying st this Hotel, make sure to book a renovated room otherwise you'll be in for a horrible experience. The staff wasn't to friendly and service minded, could be language problems...

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted in a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: panamtravelkid
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful gem in Rome - the eternal city, huge, loud, and filled with impersonal hotels. At a very reasonable rate, we found a beautifully appointed room and bathroom with nice design and open airy feel that is hard to find in Europe. Great space and layout for you to organize luggage and clothing without tripping over each other. Small things like slippers, thick soft towels and nice bath gels were a plus - even in a Superior room, not the suites. The tiny lift but worked well or it was a pleasure to take the beautiful marble staircase to our room or to the rooftop deck. The room was super dark and quiet at night - very good windows meant you could open for ventilation and close tight for quiet. The staff gave excellent recommendations for restaurants etc in multiple languages with equal ease and without drama, even with multiple guests at the same time. They made every arrangement we needed including an affordable car to the airport. The quality of service was just as good and as personalized as the much more ritzy hotel we chose in Florence. From the front desk to the restaurant to the maid service - they took care of us in a warm and seemingly effortless manner (even in high season). The breakfast buffet was the best we had in all the hotels we visited on our 2 week trip - fresh fruit and yogurt, full continental offerings including cereals, coldcuts and veggies, fresh omelets cooked to order (!), cappucinos and coffee made to your request by a friendly barista, in a charming rooftop setting.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel; perfect location; great service”
Reviews.Author: johnhoboken
Reviews.Content: Not sure where any negative reviews are coming from, but this was an absolutely perfect hotel for exploring Rome and the Vatican. First, location was great. A short walk to the Vatican, several Tiber bridges, and the subway. Second, the hotel is stunning and our room was beautiful. Very large by European standards with a travertine-covered bathroom. Air conditioning was incredible and the room was a welcome freezer after getting back from a full-day of walking around in Rome heat. Only odd thing about the room was the bathroom door which only slid "shut" and did not actually close. Third, staff was great. Answered all our questions and helped with all our needs. Staff at the restaurant/breakfast terrace were great. Fourth, cost was very reasonable. Finally, the hotel was right down the block from a fantastic gelato store - Gelateria dei Gracchi - wow! Won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average service”
Reviews.Author: Matt G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well positioned for the city centre and in particualr for the Vatican. I paid a reduced internet rate but it was still enough to expect something decent. The room was quite small, ok for a city hotel but it need painting and its small terrace whislt of benefit had a pretty awful view of the rear elevations of pretty grim neighbouring buildings. Furnishings in the room were modern, and it was clean with good AC. The bathroom was tight and whilst the walk-in shower was good, the screen wasnt sufficient to stop the bathroom flooding everytime you had a shower. My main issue was the TV and the fact it didnt work for two of the three days - we didnt need the TV a great deal and so the fact it didnt work wasnt really my gripe. The issue was that when i phoned down to reception the first time i was made to feel a bit stupid. like all of us I own a few Tv's and was pretty sure i wasnt being an idiot. I went down to reception and the receptionsist again assumed i was doing something wrong. 3rd time lucky and she reluctantly accepted i might have an issue. She promised a guy would sort it at 6. i get a knock on the door as im leaving to go out at 650 and the guy after 2 mins tells me its broken - i just think this is bad service and it irritated me. It sums up the hotel in that whislt everything is fine on the surface you get the feeling that they dont really care. The roof terrace is excellent and breakfast is good but i wont return. in my opinion without the roof terrace this would be a very bland 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Garrystone
Reviews.Content: We stopped at Isa Rome following a cruise around France and Italy, we were not dissapoined. Good location for the Vatican, great view from the roof terrrace.

Reviews.Title: “would come come back”
Reviews.Author: goadad
Reviews.Content: A lot is covered in other reviews. We found staff helpful and well manored. Breakfast on the roof overlook St Peter's Bascilica is a special treat and food is very good. One complaint...our room was on the top floor under the roof top restaurant. Staff or maybe guests too drag chairs above...can be disturbing although it did not bother us too miuch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Roof Top Garden Breakfast is Superb!”
Reviews.Author: tim b
Reviews.Content: I've recently stayed at this hotel for my son's wedding and overall had a good experience. The room is great ( newly furbished room, very clean and modern design) but beware the older room is very tiny.On the first night we were given this old room that has not been refurbished and we struggled to keep store our clothes and bags. The bathroom was very tiny and taking a shower could be tricky without wetting the floors. To be fair, the room is clean it is just the layout which is not very friendly and the tiny bathroom and room. For an enjoyable and comfortable stay request for a room that has been recently refurbished. I must mention that the roof top garden coffee house is great for breakfast. You get an amazing view of the Vatican and the free Prosecco is a good way to start the day with fresh orange juice and yummy omellete! There is a great pizzaria opposite the hotel that serves great food at a reasonable price. I highly recommend this and the mini market at the corner is great for sandwiches if you plan to pack a picnic bag with you for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cathy W
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day stay at Hotel Isa. We booked a quad room and were given a triple and a double room which worked out great! The front desk staff were extremely helpful. Our only complaint would be that the bar was not open anytime during our stay and we were looking forward to enjoying a evening drink on the rooftop. The breakfast and cappuccinos were fantastic, the best we had in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and nicely situated”
Reviews.Author: JandPNorfolk
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Isa Hotel very much. We upgraded which was worthwhile - we had a large bedroom, settee, table and chairs plus welcome balcony. Bathroom was also very spacious with balcony. Both balconies kept the room cool without the constant use of the air conditioning. Breakfasts on the roof top terrace were excellent. Everything you would have wished for - even Prosecco!!! and the views were amazing. The only downside I would give to this hotel, which meant not giving five stars, is they advertised in the room that the bar would be open from 5.30 p.m. and buffet dinners from 7.00 p.m. Neither of these were available, which was disappointing as the roof terrace was so lovely and I looked forward to dinner and drinks in the evening overlooking Rome. Most of the staff were very helpful but some were not and seemed to forget we were the customers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice on the surface - but a few issues they need to fix....”
Reviews.Author: cervezaguy12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Isa Hotel from August 4-6, 2011. It was the last stop of our summer travels to Italy and has a fabulous location that puts the Isa in close proximity to everything important for the tourist in Rome. We had 2 adjoining rooms 511 and 512. The arrangement as to how the rooms are situated works very well and is unique. We had 2 kids in one room (511) and my wife and I in the other. Both rooms have small balconies were flowers and plants. The hotel gets very high marks for the public areas and the restaurant area on the roof. The breakfast up there is fabulous and the people who manage that area are really helpful. Looking at St. Peter's Basilica while dining from the high quality buffet is terrific. The front reception staff were also good. There is a tall young man (can not recall his name), who was especially helpful and full of good advice. The issue related to one of the rooms. Room 511 was perfect. Clean, well painted and fresh with a nice bathroom. Room 512, however, had a few problems. First up is that it needs a repaint pretty badly. Second, there is substantial mold in the (nice) bathroom. And most importantly, the bathroom, which has the door out to the flowered balcony, has a lot of ants coming in and out and walking the walls of the marble shower stall walls. These are easy fixes - and I would still recommend the hotel. Hopefully the manager will read this and send in the right departments to fix the issues we encountered!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed by the staff, the location, and the design of the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BlovestoTravel143
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Europe and staying at the Isa Hotel made us very comfortable, safe, and satisfied. Having breakfast on the roof overlooking the Vatican was probably the coolest part of the hotel. The breakfast was delicious and they serve great coffee and there is a cook on site to serve you omelets. The eating area was quiet and surrounded by plants and flowers. A very nice experience. The rooms were very clean and the modern decor made me feel very comfortable. The room had a decent sized flat screen tv and a fridge undernear the window. The room also had AC, which is a huge plus to have!! The pics they show online really do look like the room we stayed in. The only downside about the room is they do not provide irons (so we had a buy a few unwrinkled shirts while we were there so that all of our pictures didn't make us look like bums!) They have a receptionist at the hotel 24 hours and they have free wireless internet. They also provide a computer in the common area downstairs for guests to use the Internet if they need to. The location of the hotel is perfect, too. It is very close the the shopping areas and restaurants, but not as close to where you are totally surrounded by tourists and people walking outside your hotel. The hotel is a few blocks down from the major tourist attractions, which is nice. They have a little grocery shop right on the corner of the hotel, which we used often to fill up on soft drinks and snacks to bring back to the hotel. If you are interested in taking the bus, the bus station is right next to the hotel. Honestly though, if you don't have bad knees or feet, you can seriously walk to every attraction. We did and it was great! A great experience and well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Isa is the way to start your trip to Italy!”
Reviews.Author: jshustef
Reviews.Content: Rome was the first of our many stops in Rome. We were on our honeymoon and Hotel Isa made us feel like we were on our honeymoon! We stayed in a room with a hot tub. It was very modern, clean and spacious. The service was excellent all around. WiFi internet was free, but only worked downstairs - not a big deal especially when you want to get away. There is a PC downstairs in case you really need it. One of the best parts of the stay is the breakfast buffet on the roof (there is also a happy hour event every night on the roof, but we were never there at the right time). There is plenty of food, the view is excellent and if the weather cooperates you will have a wonderful morning. Once you see what you get in Florence and Venice or even La Spezia for the money, you understand that this hotel is the place to stay in Rome. The location is optimal for sightseeing. We walked everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Hotel ISA...LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: pinkpunksurfer
Reviews.Content: Can't understand all the bad reviews. We stayed for 3 nights in Room 202 and loved it. We looked forward to returning to our room after visiting the sights in Rome. The downstairs seating area is beautiful, plently of newspapers and one of best bathrooms I've ever seen! Gorgeous lilly flowers and free internet access. Our room was excellent. Amazing four poster bed. Bathroom a little small but good for a European city. Great shower etc. Flat screen TV, good air-con, VERY comfy bed. But the best part was the rooftop terrace where we truely relaxed. AMAZING. Didn't mind having to go up to get coffee ourselves in the morning - its a BUFFET service, not table service! Waiters were always polite when we needed something. Omelettes made to order and endless processo - what a treat! We also went up to the terrace at 7pm ish and the waiter was happy to get us drinks and a special plate of ham/cheese. We also loved the lift - a real unique asset of the hotel and can't understand why people would complain about this!? Staff were always pleasant. We will DEFINITELY recommend Hotel ISA to all our friends and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional service, poor value for money, will never go back”
Reviews.Author: barbatrucco
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotel we have been in the past 10 years. Terrible service, unprofessional behaviour and staff tried to rip us off. Here are my reasons: -We arrived to the Hotel at 12pm on a Saturday. We were told to be back by 2pm to have room as i was not ready yet (fair enough). Back at 2:15 pm room was not ready yet and waited another 30m to have keys. When I complained with the lady at reception that room was not avaialable she didn't even try to apologize and tried to convince me that it was not their fault if previous customers left a mess in the room. We had keys of the room at 2:45pm. NOBODY offered to help with our bags (you expect a minimum service from a 4* hotel). When arrived at the floor the corridor was already stinking of cigarette. Opened the door of the room and we immediately realized somebody smoked in the room (the hotel is a non-smoking one). In addition, the room was not a double (as we booked) but a twin room. Went back to reception and complained about the room. Again, no apologies. Lady just told me that somebody must have smoked in the room.. not their fault... Clearly the rooms don't have smoke detectors. We were given another room and managed to have some rest only at 3:30pm. Room was nice but again it was stinking. This time not of cigarette but fried food as windows were open and they have their extractor fan from the kitchen going into the courtyard. - Next morning I went for breakfast at 9:45am (breakfast is from 7:30-10:30). Nice terrace with amazing view. However, buffet was nearly empty (no cakes and pastries were soggy, ham and cheese plates were nearly empty). I sat down expecting a waiter coming to order coffee or tea. After 10 minutes I realized that there was no service at the table for coffee and I should have gone to the bar to ask for it... VERY POOR service again here. NO STAFF to serve at tables in a 4* hotel????? - When I went downstairs to pay for my room, guy at reception clearly tried to rip us off. Our booking and their reservation book clearly stated that our room was EUR 190. When I ask for bill, guy told me : OK, its 210 EUR. I pointed out that we booked for EUR 190 and the guy - AGAIN not even apologizing or looking at me - said "it's now EUR 190 + 6 eur of some tourism tax. NICE TRY.... People sometimes are not so careful and that's how you make your money???? ALL in ALL, the hotel has nice rooms (although they stink) and nice terrace. But service is the worst I have ever experienced in my life. Will never go back and expecially I woulndn't reccomend to anybody. you can find nice bed&breakfast that offer a better service.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place! ISA Hotel is a rip off”
Reviews.Author: finaversaggi
Reviews.Content: In May 2011, I used Booking.com to make reservations for a one month business trip to Italy in July. I booked rooms at six different hotels in various locations using their service, and somehow, the reservation I made at the ISA hotel was confirmed at a NON-REFUNDABLE rate. Since my business plans were evolving, I made certain that all reservations could be canceled without a fee (within the given time frame), and when I noticed that the confirmation indicated that for this one hotel it was non-refundable I immediately called Booking.com AND the Hotel directly to inform them of the computer error (the reservation was for a stay two months in advance of the date i booked). I was assured by both the ISA hotel and Booking.com that I would not be charged and that I could rebook reservation as a non-refundable stay. Two days later I noticed the charge on my account - over $900 for a four day stay. I also received a cancellation notice from Booking.com - so now I paid $900 for a non-existent reservation. For two months, I traded emails and telephone calls with the Isa Hotel and Booking.com, each time I was told that the refund would post to my account within a few days. As time passed, I began cancelling all other reservations with Booking.com and re-booked those stays either directly through the hotels (these services don't offer discounts, but the hotels will if you book directly through them), or I used Hotels.com. I also visited the hotel directly on July 3 when I was in Rome (staying somewhere else obviously since I didn't have an existing reservation at a place I already paid for). The front desk person was very unhelpful and said that the manager was unavailable and that they were not required to provide a refund. This was followed up with a final email from the hotel (and another from Booking.com) completely reversing their previous indication that they would provide the refund. I did my best to rectify a computer error immediately after it occurred (which I do not believe was made by me), and yet, I was given the run around for two months, with lies and deceit. I plan to continue to flood the various hotel review sites with bad reviews for this hotel in return for their nasty and frankly immoral treatment. I tried to resolve this matter in a dignified and reasonable manner, but the hotel has no real business sense. Bad reviews are not worth the few hundred dollars they stole from us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rooftop deck, but service level needs help”
Reviews.Author: kmac071
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Isa for three nights ending our tour in Italy. We thought the location was fine, the rooms were ok for european standards, and we LOVED the rooftop terrace. The terrace and breakfast was the highlight of the stay, we looked forward to a relaxing beverage on the deck and you had a perfect view of the Vatican. Beautiful!!!! One thing that was very disappointing the was the front desk staff. I felt like we were an inconvenience to them anytime we had a question. They did not have any detailed info on buses, trains or airport shuttles. At times the service was downright rude. As far as the hotel facility itself we really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: idahozer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Isa Hotel in mid-June 2011. The rooms are very large and comfortable even by American standards. We had a street side room and the noise wasn't too bad with the windows closed. The bus stop is about two blocks away and we were able to get to the Colusseum easily within about 15 minutes. There are many restaurants and stores within a few blocks' walk. The Vatican and Vatican Museum are about a 20 minute walk away. Breakfast is included and selction of items is impressive. Mad-to-order omelets are also available. The view from the rooftop restaurant is wonderful. There is wi-fi throughout the hotel. We were a little concerned with previous complaints about rooms that had to be accessed from a walkway that skirted the courtyard below but in walking around this area I didn't feel that this was a problem. There is plently of room except perhaps travelling with an oversized suitcase. The biggest drawback with the hotel is its small elevator. We had a group of 8 people and it took three trips up and down to get people and their bags to the 4th floor. We walked the stairs most of the time. There isn't a swimming pool but there is so much to do in Rome and the kids didn't even mention that there wasn't a pool--they usually do--that it is not a concern. Most of the time the front desk was helpful but I think it depends on who is working at the time. One young lady was very knowledgeable about bus lines and routes and she was able to get us where we wanted to go; once while stuck in town I called the hotel and the gentleman had no idea how to get me where I needed to go. The staff by-and-large was very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast outdoors in the roof restaurant, looking out at St Peter's, is unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: Feenagh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Hotel Isa in June 2011 and could find no fault with this hotel. The breakfast on the hotel roof restaurant is out of this world- real fresh fruit (not a can in sight); freshly squeezed orange juice (prepared in front of you - not that awful juice usually available in Italian hotels); fresh expresso/cappuchino; prosecco (sweet or dry-make your own bucksfizz!); omelettes made on request, a great cold meats/cheese/salad bar, breads, bacon, cakes, etc. We had breakfast outdoors each morning, looking out at the dome of St Peter’s. Such a way to start your day's sightseeing in Rome. We had dinner one evening and again could not praise it higher. The pasta and meat courses were freshly prepared on request and St Peter’s looked great floodlit at night. The rooms were spotless and were cleaned every day, with plenty of quality toiletries which were replenished daily. Room size compares very well with most hotels in the cities of mainland Europe. Wardrobe space was adequate, though not extensive. Free Wifi was always available in the room. Staff were friendly and helpful with plenty of email correspondence before we arrived. Location is excellent, a few streets from the Vatican City and from Piazza Navona. The metro, which we used a few times, is a short walk away and very easy to use. Buses pass the hotel, but we never got around to using them. Rome is a city for walking! Overall an excellent hotel, at an excellent price for an excellent holiday. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Dani5512
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel ISA for 4 days and nights. The hotel is clean and lovely. We had 2 rooms on the fifth floor which had beautiful terraces. Breakfast each morning was great up in the rooftop. I have stayed in Rome several times and the hotels offer breakfast but not like this. For staying 4 nights we had a free dinner on the rooftop which was good. I would not otherwise have gone there for dinner. My only complaint is the elevator. Very small and we got stuck in it twice. Once our fault, we had 5 people crammed in and max is 4. The other time the buttons were stuck so it would move but then the door wouldn't open and it would proceed to another floor. Also there was no one to help with the luggage so you have to haul it on the elevator or walk the stairs. Overall very comfortable and friendly. Good place to stay after a long day walking in Rome! I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great breakfast, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: frauchang
Reviews.Content: Positives -location -breakfast was wonderful -friendly staff -computer in the lobby Negatives -very small rooms with not closet, just knobs to hang your clothes on the wall. This was a problem as I was there for business and couldn't properly hang my suit -bathroom toiletries not replenished (was there for a week, ran out of tissues after a few days and not refilled--didn't bother to call, annoying when I wanted one though not annoying enough to call. Also ran out of lotion.) -not vacuumed regularly (I felt stuff under my feet when I would walk barefoot) -wifi only worked the first day, unreliable afterwards

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ge0rge01
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned after reading negative reviews, but we had a great experience staying at this hotel. The rooms were very comfortable, staff extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfasts are fantastic but just a little disappointed we couldn't do the complimentary Prosecco justice, only managed one on our last morning. Our booking included a complimentary buffet dinner which was excellent. If you have a good appetite and would usually do three courses, at 29 euros the dinner is very good value William mthe barman was lovely and looked after us well. Mina (chef) very good chef and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon, lovely staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: grettie1130
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Isa back in "January of 2010 "for our honeymoon and we were very impressed. We booked the Exclusive room with the jacuzzi for a romantic stay for our honeymoon. The staff was very friendly especially while asking for dinner recommendations or directions to the nearest sites we wished to see, and always said hello each time we would enter or exit the Hotel. Our room was always clean, beds turned down each night and our bathrobes hung up and ready for us after a long walk around the city. The location was very nice, perfect distance to the Vatican, and just a short walk over the bridge to the main attractions. The only place we had a bit of a walk was the Colosseum, but complely doable, no need for Public transportation if you are able to walk a bit of a distance. Not bad at all, we really enjoyed the walk and a chance to see places on the way. The rooftop breakfast buffet was excellent. We were excited each morning to wake up and have freshly made eggs or omelets made to order, cappucinno, and a lovely spread of little croissants with chocolate, cheese and meats. Perfect breakfast to start our morning. The cook we would see daily would expect us each morning, and was always a friendly smiling face. Our stay at Hotel Isa was a fabulous one for our Honeymoon and first trip to Italy, and we would definitly come back to stay. Thanks Hotel Isa!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Crisis_Convention
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a trip to rome for my boyfriend and I, and boy were we pleased. Only a few minutes walk from Lepanto metro stop, we arrived lte evening to be greated by very pleasant reception staff, speaking good english, who promptly showed us to our room on the second floor. I had been dreading one of the old rooms, especially the orange coloured one, but we were very happy to find a beautifully decorated modern room, with a lovely bathroom, the only thing i would say was that the room was quite small, not enough room for two people to pass the end of the bed, but considering we didnt really spend too much time during the day in the room, it didnt really bother us, and the rest of the room certainly made up for what it lacked in space. Very clean, very well decorated. Although we couldnt figure out how to work the air-con, sleeping with the window open was fine, it wasnt too noisy outside. The roof terrace was absoutely lovely, with a great selection for breakfast, and an amazing view. All the staff were very friendly and polite, even the cleaning staff, who we had a few encounters with. The hotel is within walking distance to the vatican (which i would reccomend visiting both daytime and night time) and we even manged to walk back from the Trevi fountain (in the rain, might i add!), and very esy to get to most attractions with the metro stop being close by. We really enjoyed our stay, and although we payed £100 more than what our original booking had stated, we didnt mind too much as we felt it was worth the money. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Renwaa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay. I chose the Isa after a long search due to mostly good reviews at Trip Advisor but was a bit nervous after reading some. However, the gorgeous roof terrace and the central location looked good so I booked. Arrived mid-day and was quickly given our room. I braced myself to see if it was old or new (told couldn't move anyway as the hotel was booked) and didn't get cheapest choice to try and avoid the old, but sure enough, we walked into an old room and felt like it was Athens circa 1990---complete with atrocious hose hairdryer. I cannot understand in 2011 to have a 70s hairdryer that 1) took 15 minutes to dry shoulder length hair and 2) was scorching hot to hold after 5min. The room itself was spotless and put together, the bathroom good size but the old small room is huge contrast to the modern rooms advertised online and the sharp looking lobby. We also got twin beds (no way to push together and room too small for a double) so overall for Euro238/night it was a huge letdown. So much for a romantic weekend in single beds and if I was coming from overseas or on my honeymoon would be very angry. The restaurant dinner and breakfast buffets were very good (although my dinner steak was inedible shoe leather after I asked for med-rare) but the pasta during the same meal was outstanding. Go figure. The May weather was fantastic to enjoy the really great terrace so it took the edge off the disappointing room. That said, without air-conditioning in the room, I don't think I'd book during summer. Perhaps the new rooms have aircon, but ours didn't and at nearly 27C/80F already in May, it was borderline too warm. The window was open all night and the street noise was not too bad (but I lived in Mumbai and can sleep through incessant honking), but beware. The service was good and the daytime desk crew all quick, helpful, friendly and perfect English speakers. The waiters and housekeeping also were quality. The location of the hotel is good for Vatican, but no way is it a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps. More like 20+. It's 10 minutes to the foot of Ponte Umberto if you're speed walking and maybe a good 5 more to Piazza Navonna. Also be prepared to walk back to the hotel in the evening because all 3 nights it was impossible to get a taxi from anywhere (all full). The last night, we arrived at the hotel at 2am after getting lost from Campo di Fiori and after 35 minutes of walking then spent 10 minutes banging on the hotel door which was barred closed, ringing the buzzer and calling (an international call) the front desk to no answer. My husband ultimately forced the doors open and the night staffer came around the corner with a newspaper probably after hearing the loud CLANG of the metal brace on the doors hitting the marble floor. Not fun. I'm sure it was a one-off, but very aggravating so late and not knowing what we'd do if we couldn't get in. Was he sleeping? We took the train (and metro then walked) from the airport when we arrived, but got the 45euro hotel arranged car back to Fiumicino. It was a lovely ride on Sunday morning and worth the extra $$ for the convenience. So, while I liked a lot of the hotel don't think for that price would stay there again. I recommend with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel spoiled our trip.”
Reviews.Author: Fizzym
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on a recommendation. I was travelling with my Mother so I booked a room with twin beds. I went to the trouble of e mailing the hotel in English and Italian to confirm that there would be two beds in the room. A staff member called Luca e mailed back with the exact phrase " Dont worry", the booking would be as I had requested. On arrival we were met by a man called Walter at reception, his attitude was not exactly welcoming, he demanded our passports and basically threw the keys at us. We were put on the fourth floor, the lift is tiny and very old fashioned, we struggled to get to the room and when we did we discovered a double bed in a somewhat dark room with what looked like a sofa in the corner. I went back to reception and the same man literally shrugged his shoulders, there were no other rooms,and tried to persuade me that the sofa was a bed. I pointed out that it had no bedlinen on it, or pillow, and asked to speak to the manager. He claimed he was in charge, which I subsequently discovered was a lie. He eventually gave us another room on the second floor. He did not offer us help with our bags and he did not apologise for the mistake. We took this other room which was much smaller and even darker than the original room, but at least it had twin beds . He did not tell us that there was building work going on next door, that there was a scaffold right outside our room, or that we would hear noise from the kitchen staff as they smoked in the courtyard and chatted late at night. We could also hear the person above us very clearly as the ceiling was very thin, and we could hear noise from reception. Basically he gave us the room from hell, and based on his attitude afterwards he seemed to have done it deliberately because we had complained. When my mother complained again she was told that her comments had been noted and someone would get back to her. No one got back to her, we spent three nights listening to the noise, and our days trying to enjoy Rome but exhausted from lack of sleep. When we checked out I was not asked one question about whether we had enjoyed our stay or not. They just took the money and that was that. They even gave us incorrect information about getting to the airport. To sum up, we enjoyed Rome, but to enjoy it fully you need a good nights sleep, Hotel Isa did spoil our trip. The housekeeping staff and restauraunt staff were nice, but their booking section is a joke, and their reception staff beyond rudeness. Having stayed in other hotels in Rome, I would avoid this, you can do much better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abhilash S
Reviews.Content: We reached in the afternoon from Paris. At reception they welcomed us in a proper manner. They have helped with the maps to find the monuments and helped us to book the train ticket to Venice. The room was good. The best part is the breakfast of this hotel. We really liked it as you have all the verities.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: Sari_11
Reviews.Content: Very good location, only 10 minutes walk to Spanish steps and Vatican is just around a corner. Subway is also nearby. Room was clean, a bit small, but not too much, bathroom was spacy with nice french balkony and breakfast at the roofterrace was awesome! Nice view to vatican! Only one minus: pillows! Such a sausages!

Reviews.Title: “great 4 days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sitries
Reviews.Content: Overall had a great stay at the Hotel Isa. Took my gf there for her xmas present, decided to pay for a superior room when I booked with expedia. Upon arrival, the hotel looked beautiful, very grand luxurious lobby with very attentive staff who spoke good english which was helpful when going to a new city. We were very dissapointed when we entered our room as we had been given one of the 'traditional' (old!) rooms rather than one of the 'modern' newly renovated rooms - especially as i had pre paid for an upgrade. Marched down to the lobby to explain the situation and the guy at reception said he could arrange a modern room for us later that day, which suited us as we wanted to get straight out and start site seeing. Later that day, our room was ready and was of a 5 star standard - we were very impressed! Room was cleaned to an excellent standard every day and staff were all very polite and helpfull. The breakfast was decent with a chef making fresh omlettes and the view from the hotel rooftop whilst eating breakfast in the sun was beautiful - could see right over to the vatican. All in all i was very happy with my hotel choice in Rome and would recommend highly to others. Only downside would be if no modern rooms had of been available because the contrast between modern and old rooms was vast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice value for money”
Reviews.Author: vadnu
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Isa Hotel for a week during our spring vacation to Rome, and we couldn't have been happier; the hotel is super nice, the service is excellent, the rooms are kept very clean, and the breakfast buffet is extremely nice. I was a bit worried before going there whether the location on the 'wrong' side of the Tiber would be an issue for walking around Rome, but I needed not worry; if you just choose the shortest route everything is within easy walking distance from this nice hotel. PS: If you can make sure to get a room towards the courtyard. It will isolate you from street noise and secure a great sleep after a busy day in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: WalesShadwell
Reviews.Content: Breakfast on the roof terrace was excellent with plenty of choice.Mark the breakfast waiter was friendly and helpful.The same could be said of Willy the head waiter who served us our evening meal.Nothing was to much trouble for the both of them.Whilst the evening meal was expensive,it still represented good value relative to other restaurants around the Hotel.I agree with a previous reviewer who commented about the smell around the lift area .It was pungent,but we held our breath as we walked past.The location was perfect,the Vatican around 10 minutes away on foot.In fact, we visited all the landmarks and sites on foot,It really was easy to get around

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bath_rugby_fan
Reviews.Content: Positives - friendly staff and good range at breakfast, location is quite good, tho there could be more public transport information available Negatives - room was small, a/c was unintelligible (and there were no instructions) hence it was stiflingly hot. TV was bizarre to get working, bed was quite uncomfortable

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Isa, great location and service”
Reviews.Author: JanusLondon
Reviews.Content: You won't find a better hotel than this one offering good service and great location (ie 5 minutes from Castel St. Angelo). Breakfast is served on the roof terrace with great views of Rome and the Vatican

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss. Good location. Clean hotel. But be careful that you get what you think you are booking and paying for!”
Reviews.Author: LibbyK-001
Reviews.Content: On the positive: A very clean hotel. Good location in a nice area - you can walk everywhere! Buffet breakfast was fantastic and well worth the money. Staff were friendly and spoke excellent English. On the downside: There was a smell in lift area which remained throughout our stay. Very noisy at night if staying on 2nd floor (The 5th floor was not as bad). We had problems with the service desk regarding our reservation which unfortunately ruined our 3 night romantic stay. We booked an exclusive double for 3 nights back in November (3.5 months in advance) for our anniversary. On arrival we didn't think we got an exclusive room and when we asked about it we were fobbed off and told that we have been given one of their newer exclusive rooms. The room we were given was nice (Room 204) but was about 1/2 the size that it was meant to be and didn't have a balcony. It was newly decorated with a jacuzzi that was in the separate bathroom located down a hallway. It wasn't however a patch on the larger 'luxury' room with jacuzzi located within in the bedroom (Room 509) and balcony that we thought we were going to get for our romantic long weekend. We were charged the same price (276 Euros a night) for this smaller room. I'd have felt it was more a superior room and 180-200 Euros would have been a more appropriate pricing for it. After complaining again a little later in the day we were offered a 'deal' to move into one of the rooms we'd actually thought we'd booked. But the deal was that we could have the room for 1 night only and not the 2 that we had remaining. So each night of our stay we'd be spending in a different room.... What the????? Yes we would have to move again the following morning but this time into a (downgraded) superior double with no jacuzzi. This is because they wanted to give the room we had to someone else for valentine's day and all other exclusive rooms were taken. No consideration was given to our actual booking, our holiday and experience at their hotel. It was just expected that we'd happy pack and unpack each night. We booked 3.5 months ahead and our reservation had comments on what we wanted and that it was for our anniversary. Our booking was accepted by them and yet we were made to feel like they were doing us a huge favour by letting us stay in an exclusive room at all. After complaining again we were allowed to stay in the 2nd room we had been moved into for the remaining 2 nights. The room was as luxurious as I had expected it would be but it was also a little tired ie: it had an older style decor. Our stay may just be one of those unfortunate and bad luck things that happen from time to time but if asked the question - would I spend 3 x 276 Euros a night again on what we got from a service, physical room and most importantly 'experience' point of view - no way in the world. I've stayed in Rome before and wouldn't pay this kind of money again for the what we received this time around.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel, very friendly restauarant staff, roofto restauarant overlooking the Vatican is a highlight.”
Reviews.Author: CVS010
Reviews.Content: Expensive but wortth it. Memorable stay. Very good location and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chuck054
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel is very nice. Clean room, friendly staff, very good buffet breakfast, close to the Vatican. The private bathroom had a nice shower. The free wireless internet worked without a hitch. I will definitely come here again when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellersdream
Reviews.Content: Small but excellent hote with design interior. Our room on the top (5th) floor had a great view over the city including nearby St.Peter's. Staff (both recepetion and restaurant) were polite and helpful. Unfortunately the Airco only supplied very warm air and we could not sleep with open windows because of the street noises. We had booked a deal including a free dinner, but found out only later that the restaurant was closed till after our stay. We received a small compensation but would have preferred to have dinner in the nice rooftop restaurant which has a magnificent view. Breakfast was very good with great choice. You could even have a glass of Prosecco with your breakfast. The location is great, with most of the interesting places within walking distance and others reachable with nearby buses and subway. Despite the small discomfort of the failing Airco, we willcertainly be back here.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rvrtrips
Reviews.Content: This place LOOKS as beautiful as it is!! really, super nice staff, I felt like it was super elegant. The breakfast was AMAZING!!! A chef making omlets, so wonderful food. I ate the best when I had breakfast there. The standard double room is where we stayed our first night; then upgraded to the exclusive room with a jacuzzi.. The jacuzzi tub was nice, but not like the pictures we saw online. (there could've been more and different exclusive rooms, but the one we stayed in, was not like the photos). It was SO NICE though. I would DEFINITELY stay there, and I did like the exclusive room, but I wouldn't cry over staying in a double room...The price difference was about a 1/3 (the double room costing 1/3 of what the exclusive room did). They were virtually the same room, but with a little more room, better view, and bigger tub. Otherwise... I will ALWAYS stay at this hotel.. Oh yeah, it was kinda far from any public transportation so we walked to get everywhere since we're not big taxi cab people. The metro stop was prob 4-5 blocks away, but really ... a GREAT HOTEL! Oh lastly -- the wi-fi was free and so was breakfast -- all was included and I LOVED THAT!!!

Reviews.Title: “We will return again!”
Reviews.Author: Barfod
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, great location - close to everything - wonderful champagne breakfast, buffet, balcony, bathtub, friendly and helpful staff. It is strongly recommended to try the evening buffet - the best meal we had in Rome - and if you buy 4 nights, you get a free dinner. One only drawback - the beds were quite hard! We will certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: YWGandBeyond
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located. The Vatican is a 20 minute walk and the nearest Metro stop is just 10 minutes away. The complimentary breakfast buffet on the roof top terrace was an enjoyable way to start our day. We found the staff friendly and helpful. There is a computer in the lobby with free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraGMoscow
Reviews.Content: Being in Rome not for a first time, we decided to choose the hotel not in the historic center, but in the leaving area not far from main attractions. And we made a right choice, the hotel is not bad, the room was big (for Rome), the bathroom too, and walking distance to piazza Navona is 7-10 minutes. The breakfast was really good, on the roof-terrace, with spumante, fresh juice and egg-station; as we booked the room for 4 nights, we've got a complimentary buffet dinner in the same restaurant, and it was really not bad, with glass of sparking wine, good veriety of vegetable antipasta, fresh homemade pasta, great beefsteak, fruit plate and dessert. The only item which should be improved - is the hairdryer (too poor) and the configuration of shower - there were no door, and all the floor was as after big rain. But our general impression - not bad, and even good.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - only glitch, Internet was down.”
Reviews.Author: Urbantraveler504
Reviews.Content: Room was small but I think this may be usual with Euro style hotels. Convenient location for sightseers in the mid of Vatican area. Comfort, decor and several nice windows that open made up for the size of the room. Rooftop bar and breakfast area is Gorgeous. The breakfast was so delectable and view fantastic. Bar staff is friendly. Internet was down, which was a big bummer. We benefited from "last minute" booking online.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a quiet area of Rome near Vatican”
Reviews.Author: rothsberg
Reviews.Content: We arrived to our hotel and were pleasantly surprised by the foyer and main area as you walk in. Reception guy was polite on our arrival, but not sincere or genuinely friendly. Room was old fashioned, very Italian in style. But room was very clean and serviced very well everyday. Breakfast nothing to write about, pretty basic, but ok to get day started with. Hotel has some great "local" restaurants that aren't touristy with great food, Supermarket around corner. 15 minutes walk to Vatican and also 20 minutes walk to City centre. Was overall happy with hotel and location, but you need to get a good rate for it to be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value boutique hotel in quiet but central location.”
Reviews.Author: wrpt
Reviews.Content: Having done a lot of research on where to stay in Rome for 3 nights with my wife and two teenage sons, I was delighted that the Hotel Isa met our expectations. It is located on the left bank of the river and is only a 5 minute walk to the Vatican and St. Peters. The city centre is very compact so we were still only 15 minutes walk from Piazza Navona and all the surrounding sites, shops and restaurants. The hotel itself has been refurbished recently and it makes a good first impressions on arrival. We were greeted by the smiling Fabio who was very helpful during our stay. We chose one of their family rooms which is essentially 2 rooms that are annexed off the central stair and lift and overlook an internal courtyard making them very quiet. The rooms are quite small (although I think that most rooms in Rome are) but they were very comfortable and clean. Flat screen TV with lots of Sky channels and free and instant broadband were useful too. Each had bathrooms with showers. We had tried to book one with a bath but it is not an option. We stayed in late October so the tempretaure of the rooms were good and we didn't have to use the air conditioning. One of the best features of the hotel is the rooftop terrace that looks over to the dome of St. Peter's Basilica. This is the perfect spot for a pre dinner drink as the sun goes down and the lights of Rome begin to switch on. The bar and restaurant are supervised by the tireless and wonderful Willy who looked after us very well. We didn' t choose to dine in the hotel restaurant despite the location as it never looked as if it was going to be that busy. Perhaps it is different in the summer. We did use it for breakfast however which was excellent. It had a great choice including fresh fruit, cooked to order eggs, breads, meats, cereals and even a glass of Prosecco if you wished. The public spaces on the ground floor by reception were really only used as waiting areas rather than a place to relax. Given the poor exchange rate against the £ then most hotels are very expensive so I was pleasantly surprised at the room rate which included breakfast for our 3 nnight stay. All in all we were very happy with the quality and value of our stay at the Isa and would definitely visit again and recommend it others.

Reviews.Title: “A few more smiles would have been lovely”
Reviews.Author: chebs66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Isa for a long weekend. We had read the reviews and the place sounded ideal. In all fairness, it was fine for what we wanted as we hadn't planned on staying too long in the hotel itself. We walked everywhere from there but it certainly not a central hotel and making your way over to the bridge to get to Piazza Navona is a little hazardous given the traffic zooming around Piazza Cavour. The receptionist who checked us out was friendly enough but the chap who was there for most of the time was pretty grimfaced and didn't respond to any greeting - preferring to look the other way. For much of the stay there was a fairly revolting smell around the reception area but as noone else has mentioned this, I guess that it is temporary. It certainly put me off using the computer in the lobby as I couldn't hold my breath for that long! The lift was ancient and a little temperamental but this wasn't really too much of any issue. Our room was spotless and, whilst it was on the small side, it was perfectly adequate. The air con was a little feeble and, on the first night, we assumed that it was not available as the windows were open when we arrived in the room. We therefore kept the window open - Big Mistake! The road was incredibly noisy and we hardly slept until we shut the window. Once shut, the soundproofing was not too bad. The cleaner showed us how to work the air con the following morning so the following nights were much better. The views from the breakfast terrace are great. We stuck to prosecco and water as the juices were synthetic. I would also recommend asking the waiter for a cappucino or espresso as the coffee provided for you to help yourself is quite stewed and strong. It is very much a case of help yourself at breakfast - I guess we are used to waiters showing us to a table and explaining where things are but this is not something that happens at Isa. It sounds as though we didn't enjoy our stay. We did but thought that a few things could have been done better.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous terrace with view of the vatican”
Reviews.Author: T_na13
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel with old world charm, yet modern. Fabio was fabulous at the front desk, the breakfast was also. Fresh omelettes, orange juice, champagne, cappuccino, fruit , meats, cheese,and pastries on a great terrace overlooking the Vatican is a great way to start your day! A small tip (3 euro each for awesome service) to the chef and server, provided us with them getting what we wanted without asking, bringing it to our table for the next 5 days. We felt special and appreciated all their hard work. Location is far enough away from the tourists, yet walking distance to Piazza Navona, Vatican, Castel Dangelo, Piazza Popolo. Great shopping 4 blocks away many local restaurants to enjoy affordable food. you'll feel like a local, which was what we wanted. Our room 505 had floor to ceiling doors that opened to a small terrace with 2 chairs/ also one in the bathroom. Handcrafted King size round bed that rotated so you could look out of the doors or watch the 42" tv on the wall. Downfall was that 5th floor is below the terrace, so you woke up to the chairs scooting across the floor. Which was ok because the room has NO clock, it became our wake-up call! (No iron either, someone burnt their room up apparently). Room also had a small fridge, 2 closets and a large bathroom with double sinks, make-up counter, badet and shower. Tried ALOT of Gelato in Rome and Sorrento... the best is across the street from this hotel. Practice your Italian, they take pride in their language and 80% of the people we encountered for the 2 weeks we were there speak little english. Be aware the elevator is origional to the building, very small (fits 2 people and 2 suitcases) also up 2 steps, so you have to carry your luggage a bit. The lobbies are nice- both small with leather couches and a hidden bathroom through a door noone seems to notice. They also have a computer to use in the lobby with free internet-standing use only so noone stays on it too long. Take ear-plugs, if you need quiet. Rome is loud no matter where you stay... lots of buses, mopeds, cars and garbage trucks come out at night. Plus they are great for the LOOONG plane trip, crying children or snoring people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: alexg48
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here. You'll be hard pressed to find a better value in Rome. The services are limited, but that is to be expected; it is a 'boutique' hotel after all. Our room was ready to check in when we arrived early from the States. Clean, comfortable room with balcony off bathroom and bedroom. A round bed. Front desk staff very friendly and accomodating. The breakfast is just what you'd want...low key, attentive service, good choice,wonderful, looking out on San Pietro. We learned on the last day that if you go right out of the door of the hotel you'll find yourself away from tourist areas. There are excellent neighborhoods, shopping, and dining. It's what Trastevere used to be. All in all, a wonderful, low-key hotel just far away from the tourist madness, but close enough to explore Rome or a decent cab fare away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MattTKE
Reviews.Content: Hotel Isa was great. It was a great hotel with a perfect location and a great price. The breakfast every morning was very good. It is more European geared as in meats and breads, which I loved. There was an egg station if you like as well. The only downfall was the front desk guy always looked like you were bothering him or he plain just didn't like you. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great service- great location!”
Reviews.Author: Gjedde1
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with this hotel- true value for money. Friendly staff, good breakfast (included) and prime location near the Vatican City and Piazza del Popoli. Great roof restaurant with view to St.Peter's Church.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely stay at Hotel Isa the next time I travel to Rome,”
Reviews.Author: tmonet
Reviews.Content: Hotel Isa is located close to shopping, the Vatican and many other noted attractions. The breakfast buffet is spectacular and Willy at the evening bar is a sweetheart! The rooms are quite comfortable, clean and updated. Loved Hotel Isa!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel at good location”
Reviews.Author: Mdekduy
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel, though not trendy but with a sophisticated Italian touch. It is clean and comfortable. Staff is friendly. (Much friendlier than the rest of Roman people whom we found very rude and impolite.) The breakfast area is wonderful, looking out on the Vatican Cathedral. The breakfast is good, with multiple choice. The beds are splendid! The room not large, but clean, with a small balcony. The shower is comfortable too. The tube station is a five-minute walk from the hotel. The Navona square a five to ten-minute walk. We would certainly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Ros058
Reviews.Content: Of the thousands of hotels in Rome, we struck very lucky with the Isa. Great location for walking to all major sites, or when the legs tire, there are frequent buses which pass the front door and the metro is about a 7 minute walk. We stayed for 4 nights in a family room on the 4th floor - 2 separate rooms accessed from small entrance hall each with shower-room - ideal for a family with older children, or extended family. Staff all helpful and friendly. The highlight was the roof garden (dining and bar area) - with magnificent views over St. Peter's Basilica. Lovely buffet breakfast served and the evening buffet at 28 euros (4 courses) is very good value for Rome with extensive "help yourself" antipasti, followed by a pasta dish, then main meat/fish course and dessert. We chose the beef steak - the tastiest meat we have eaten in years!. Roof garden staff all fantastic - a particular thanks to barman Willy - who ensured our stay was relaxing and memorable. We would have rated the Isa excellent all round - but have 2 niggles. One is the rock hard double bed, so our sleep quality was not the best, and secondly the canopy lighting over the bed was very bright and couldn't be dimmed. This was a bit of a problem as there were no bed-side reading lights. The Ristorante Al Palazzaccio just round the corner from the hotel is also well worth a visit - the spaghetti carbonara is stunning! Turn right out of the hotel and then first right and you are there in less than 2 minutes . We can also recommend romepickup.com who offer a 40 euro taxi (4 people) from Fiumicino airport to centre of Rome. Book on-line - no payment required in advance. One of our bags took over an hour to arrive at the airport and the driver was still waiting for us in the arrivals hall.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable value, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: missy2z
Reviews.Content: At the price we booked this hotel at, we were waiting for the catch...... We were absolutely totally impressed with the room and the sevice, We stayed in a triple room and found it bright, spacous and airy. The breakfast was the best ever, worth linguring over! The was my second trip to Rome and I will definately return to this hotel the next trip. Staff were amazing, always cheerful. Thank you Hotel Isa!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Vatican and wonderful staff, very helpful & friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravelling6060
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly as soon as we walked in the door! They were helpful in getting directions and recommendations for buses, cafe's and stores. The rooms were larger than I expected with very clean and spacious bathrooms. The rooftop garden was beautiful and breakfast buffet very good. Our teenager especially liked the older style elevator. The location was perfect for us, walking distance even with older extended family to the Vatican was easy. Perfect bus stop for access across the river (if you don't want to walk the several blocks) was just 1.5 blocks away. Loved it and will return to Hotel Isa when we return to Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “A GOOD Trip To Remember!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hinser
Reviews.Content: To start - just some backround info. We are a newlywed, middle class couple, living in Philadelphia, PA, USA and decided to take our first trip to Europe. We settled on Rome after some back and forth between Paris and London. We made the right call! So this is our review of the hotel and some tips on Rome. Enjoy... We booked the Hotel Isa for our first trip to Rome the first week of May, 2010. We initially were concerned about the hotel after the many reviews we saw online (keep in mind MOST of the bad reviews were from a few years ago) - but in the end we decided if we kept our expectations low we would end up happy. This was the perfect way to set ourselves up for a PERFECT vacation and our best vacation as a couple. We left the Hotel Isa AND Rome in awe!! After we booked using Expedia I emailed the hotel and requested a decent room or an upgrade due to the fact that this option was unavailable online through the website. When we arrived were booked into Room 407 (the honeymoon suite as they call it) - my wife and I were pleasantly surprised at how basic yet suitable this room was after the horror stories we read online (both at the Hotel Isa and in Europe in general). The room was on the fourth floor, up the old fashioned elevator, and just to the right. Outside we had a view of an urban/residential street that was quiet most of the time at this elevation - with the exception of the trash trucks early one morning. (Remember you are in one of the world's largest cities - not Utopia - there will be things that aren't totally perfect). Keep remembering this and you'll be fine. The room had a smaller feel but being forwarned online, there was enough room for the both of us. The bathroom was very tiny, about the size of a cruise ship bathroom - but again this is the norm for Europe - so we have been told. I would, again, recommend this hotel to people if they keep an open mind. It WAS clean at all times. The service was spotty and by this I mean it depends on who you were dealing with. The front desk, when manned by Fabio - I think that's his name (a middle aged man with colorful designer glasses) was VERY helpful. He was EXTREMELY helpful and worth the reference. Most other times the service was adequate with one exception. There was a much younger individual who, when asked for dinner recommendations and help for a reservation, was horrendous. When asked for a NICE & pricey spot for a "memorable last dinner in Rome" he recommended touristy or not so memorable spots. He said he was new to town and again was barely offering help even when it was drug out of him. We finally settled on Casa Bleve (after some research online using the free internet/computer station in the lobby - BOY WE LUCKED OUT!!! This place was awesome) - pricey, but good food, great wine list, Roman through and through - a highlight of our trip - it was even Michelin rated. We highly recommend this place as a last night/anniversary/memorable spot for dinner. The housekeeping service was impeccible. And the breakfast upstairs (we never ate dinner at the hotel) on the roofdeck was the perfect way to start each day. The food was typical Italian/Roman with OJ, Pineapple Juice, meats, cheeses, pastries, fruits and an Omelette bar. All of which was a perfect and FREE way to start the day!! The hotel was in a GREAT location for walkers. We WALKED EVERYWHERE!! Twice we walked all the way down to the Colosseum using the Via Del Corso. Great dining, shopping, the Vatican, and historic sites were all within walking distance for the two of us in our early 30s. If you are impaired or not a walker - I'd think about about staying somewhere else - but we wanted to take Rome in - and WE DID!! Everyday walking over or along the Tiber going to the Vatican or into the "touristy/historic" parts of the city. I'll finish with a few tips that we found worthwhile and a few we added ourselves for you. -Dine at Casa Bleve (Via del Teatro Valle, 49, 00186 Roma, Italia 066 865970) -Tartufo at Tre Scalini in the Piazza Navonna. A PHENOMENAL dessert. Although it is touristy it is absolutely worth it! -Dinner at the Piazza de la Rotunda, we did this a few nights. There are a few spots right next to the Pantheon. Decent food and a GREAT view! We did this on our first night. It was a short walk and a nice way to start the trip. -We found this tip beforehand. When going to the Colosseum/Forum. Get the Romapass from the Tabacchi station just outside the Colosseum Metro Station (it is extremely easy to find - coming from Historic Rome it'll be on your left when facing the Colosseum). It saves you money and time!! -Taxis are not as expensive as Philadelphia (where we live), NYC or DC. Use them if you need to. -You HAVE to go see the Vatican and The Sistine Chapel (Cappela Sistina). BUT get a tour guide. We waited over an hour to get in - and that was SHORT - thanks to a tour guide. It woulda been at least a three hour wait otherwise. OH - and don't go to The Vatican on a Monday. The crowds were killers! -See the many churches!! They are museums in and of themselves. Some we love and recommend - do some research and think about them: - -Santa Maria della Vittoria (the only Gothic church in Rome - beautiful and right next to the Pantheon), - -St Peter in Chains (San Pietro in Vincoli), which holds two sets of chains that were supposedly placed on St Peter himself. - -San Giovanni in Laterano, which is next to "The Holy Steps" which Jesus climbed to meet Pontius Pilate. - -The Capuchin Crypt. An old crypt that holds the bones of over 4,000 monks. Plus we get the name Cappuccino from there. We recommend you look these up and do your research. All of the churches, like St. Peter in Chains even have Michelangelo statues in them - as though the chains weren't enough. Crazy and just beautiful - all of these places!!
