But be warned of the down times. From roughly noon/1pm to 3pm-ish the churches close. So make sure you know what the hours are before you get there. -If you get the chance, do the Audience with the Pope. We actually were lucky enough to get into the "Newlywed Section" (you get this by applying to the Bishops' Office for US Visitors to the Vatican) and were VERY close to the Pope. This was about an hour to two hour engagement. But if you sit in the crowd you can leave at anytime. Arrive early - we were there around 7:30 or 8am to get a good seat even in the reserved section. Do this in the general seating and you'll have good spot to see the Pope pass by both times in his Popemobile. -We wanted to hit an American bar and watch some sports - just as a side diversion for a drink or two and found an AWESOME one - even though it was hard to find. Highlander Pub at Vicolo di San Biagio, 9, 00186 Rome. VERY friendly to Americans and a great place to watch some games (we were there during the Stanley Cup playoffs and wanted to watch part of a Flyers game). -We booked a wine tasting/food tour through Presto Tours ("Wine Tasting in 2 Rome Enotecas") and were lucky enough to get Ettore. He was AWESOME!! He took us around and completely broke Rome down for us. The tour was supposed to last three hours but we spent five just chatting, learning about wine, food and life in general in Rome. Just a GREAT evening! -When booking the Hotel Isa email them ahead of time and request a private driver. For two people it is only 50 Euro and they will pick you up AT the airport in a private Mercedes and drive you straight to the hotel. I recommend this over a cab ride! -Finally I was told that if you have an overnight flight from the States you will be tired when you hit Rome. FIGHT the urge to nap or you will put the rest of the trip behind the 8 Ball. Instead an easy way to keep occupied and awake is go on a "touristy" Double Decker bus tour. They are reletively inexpensive and you see all the sights. This will give you an idea of where things are BEFORE you go out on foot later in the week. You can find these busses right in front of the Vatican - just a ten minute walk from the Hotel Isa. So get on the bus, go grab lunch, take a short nap and then hit dinner (maybe at the Piazza de la Rotunda??). -We made the mistake of eating lunch outside of the Vatican that first day. Fight the urge and eat around the Hotel. The food is less pricey and a little bit less touristy. It is a better meal and worth your while! -Go to the Spanish Steps - day AND night . Rome is a city where you can drink alcohol on the streets. Our first night there was a food/drink cart at the top of the steps and we grabbed some beers and sat on the Steps just relaxing and enjoying the Roman air. We went back later in the week and the cart was gone. But that can't stop you from bringing your own beer/wine and taking it all in - preferrably at night. Amazing!! Overall - ROME IS AMAZING!!! This is just a general guide and only a sliver of what we recommend and experience. Feel free to email and request info or run an idea past us! You will love Rome. Also - try the Hotel Isa. Request room 407 and you'll be fine. Keep expectations low and you'll be fine. Remember you are in Rome... ... ...and you'll be fine! Good luck and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sandlady48
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful gem in the middle of Rome. We were within walking distance of the Vatican, Castle St. Angelo, Piazza Navona, and many shops and restaurants, with easy access to city tour buses to get to many other attractions. From the rooftop restaurant we enjoyed cocktail hour, breakfast, dinner and a great view of St. Peter's Basilica. And did we ever enjoy the breakfast, it was a very complete buffet with prosecco and blood orange juice in addition to to many other delicious selections. The rooms were comfortable with robe and slippers. Internet access was available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “True 4 Star Property”
Reviews.Author: LaStar1980
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Isa is the best choice if you like to stay in a Rom Downtown 4 Star Hotel with very nice rooms and a very friendly and professional Staff. The Hotel has a fantastic roof tarrace where breakfast is served and with a breathtaking view on the vatican. If you like to do a lot of site seeing, this is the perfect Hotel to do so, everything is in walking distance. I highley recommend this fantastic Hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Enjoyable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ws1983
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Hotel Isa and once again our stay was comfortable and enjoyable! Thanks for a great visit!

Reviews.Title: “unless you have a modern room, dont bother”
Reviews.Author: svale26
Reviews.Content: we booked thos hotel following its cool website, with modern rooms, we also requested a mdoern room... When we arrived the lobby seemed very promising, very stylish and hip. However, up the rackety lift and we reached our room- seomthing out of the 90's with matching wal and bed print and cheap fixtures. We asked if it would be possible to change our room to a more modern one which it was not, Upon being told this, we asked why we hadnt been assigned with our request- we were told that the only modernised rooms we one floor- out of six.... Breakfast was very good with a lovely view over rome. however one morning it was not set up at 7:00- nohting was available. Do not go unless you are guaranteed one of the new rooms

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: patty749
Reviews.Content: Isa Hotel was wonderful, and a great location, walking distance to the Vatican and the Metro, resturants etc. Staff was very nice and helpful and the room was huge and clean and nicely decorated, Free breakfast was outstanding, and Willy the bartender made some great drinks at night before heading out on the town. very hightly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for Rome. Modern rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Kakadouli
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome to visit Vatican. From the Hotel you can go by foot in 30 mins to Vatican. The Hotel romms are small but newly renovated/modern. Bathrooms are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a super location”
Reviews.Author: vmi384
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights in Rome and we were extremely pleased with our selection of Isa Hotel. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. All spoke English well and were able to answer our questions and provide recommendations. Check-in/out was simple and easy...no hassles what-so-ever. Our room (310) was a Superior Room and was spacious by European standards. The bed was an odd size (smaller than a king but bigger than a queen), however, very comfortable; the bathroom was big; and the room had a nice balcony that overlooked the courtyard. The room's decor was unique, with a Roman style which added to the atmosphere. The rooftop terrace was awesome with a super view of the dome of St. Peter's Basilica. The complimentary breakfast buffet was very good by any standard (American or European). From the hotel, it is an easy walk to the Vatican, the Spanish Steps, the Pantheon, Piazza Novana, Trevi Fountain, etc. Even in 90 degree plus heat, we found the walks rather easy, and besides, after eating all the great food Rome has to offer you will need to walk it off. Additionally, the hotel is easily accessible yet it is located in a quiet neighborhood away from all tourism traffic. Very good shopping three blocks away all along Via Coladi Rienzo. Additionally, there is a small grocery store one block away on Via Tacito. Without thinking twice, we would definitely select Hotel Isa again or recommend it to any of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, great location and rooftop terrace for breakfast and cocktails”
Reviews.Author: ChristineW88
Reviews.Content: Our June 2010 stay at Hotel Isa in Rome was very nice. The rooms and bathrooms were well appointed, beds comfortable. The hotel is nicely decorated with photos of Rome architecture. The location is very convenient to all major sites, especially if you don't mind walking. The location is also out of the main tourist hustle and bustle. Many very good restaurants are in walking distance. The best part of the hotel is the rooftop terrace with stunning views of St. Paul's dome at night. Breakfast is on the terrace and the bar is open most nights for drinks. The hotel put up a big screen for all to watch the World Cup!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Well Presented, Well Located”
Reviews.Author: Debra3575
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days 3 nights and covered all places of interest on foot. Hotel room was clean, modern, a lit small, however we didn't plan to spend much time in the room, we were here to see the sights. Air conditioning was useful as this is a city and therefore quite noisy at night. Breakfast is served buffet style on the roof terrace which has a lovely view of St Peters and the buffet was excellent. We booked via Expedia and didn't book transfer however there is an excellent ShuttleBus service available from the airport to Piazza Cavour/Termini for 15 euros open return, this hotel is located on one of the streets that comes off of Piazza Cavour and therefore this is an ideal mode of transfer. We would recommend a trip to Rome, it really is an amazing place and we would recommend this hotel for it's location (not right in the thick of it, but close enough to walk everywhere), it's decor and cleanliness. The only slight draw back is that there is not anywhere to stowe your luggage on the last day although they are happy for you to leave luggage in reception this is not monitored or secure.

Reviews.Title: “Regret booking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: timisiytangco
Reviews.Content: The hotel was overpriced, service was almost non-existent (except for a nice bellhop who carried my bags and wouldn't accept a tip), the free Internet was down one entire day, and the rooftop garden was not as advertised in the shiny photos on the hotel website. If you are in Rome to see the sights, you are better off staying in other parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - Lousy Dinner Buffet”
Reviews.Author: omnipred
Reviews.Content: The hotel has free wifi in the lobby as well as a pc for you to use if you didn't bring your own laptop. The rooms were eclectic. Small but functional bathrooms. Clean rooms. Fairly close to the Vatican, and a bit of a walk to the rest of Rome (since it's on the northwest side of the river). The breakfast buffet on the rooftop was the best, sparkling wine, hot food as well as cold food, and fresh squeezed juices. Apparently breakfast is included at all the Italian hotels we stayed at. WARNING: Don't eat at the hotel for dinner, the buffet was awful. Maybe it was because we booked the New Year's Eve dinner buffet (which cost $10 more than usual, came out to $70/person not including drinks). It was mostly h'orderves and cold dishes. The chef would bring out steaming piles of mussels and pasta and fish to the other tables, but for some reason my wife and I were completely neglected. There was another young couple that was completely neglected as well and seemed frustrated with the lack of service. The service was mainly catering towards a large party at our expense. Maybe it's because we didn't order their overpriced bottles of wine. We eventually left the buffet completely unsatisfied, went down to the lobby to complain about the poor service, and was told they would look into it. We never heard back and didn't get an apology, then again we didn't really expect to hear back. Completely ruined our NYE experience in Rome. As long as you avoid the dinner buffet and don't mind walking to the rest of Rome, I can recommend this hotel. Otherwise, I would highly recommend staying on the other side of the river.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ISA - Good Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Gossy-abroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in room 402 - if you look on Google street veiw its covered in scaffold, its all complete now. Location The location is a 15 minute walk from the nearest metro, 20 minutes walk from the Trident area, 20 minutes and youre at the Vatican, 1 hour 45 minutes to the colesseum. We booked a flight through Easyjet and a transfer via the same site with holiday Taxi's. The cost was 60 euro for an hours travel, we would recommend pre-booking a transfer or agreeing a fixed price as traffic gets busier nearer the city - alternatively take the train to the central terminus then metro. Our return journey was 50 euro, and on a Sunday took 40 minutes. Food The hotel does a good breakfast, breads jams, toast, juice etc, and hard boiled eggs, bacon and scrambled eggs, the chef is on hand Mon-Friday to cook omlettes and make fresh coffee. Champagne/sparkling wine is left on the centre table for you to serve yourself. From the roof top restaurant/bar you can see the St Paul Basilica dome In the evenings there is a buffet, we tended not to use it as we ate out at the many nearby restaurants/trattoriers - there are at least 5 good places to eat nearby, as well as the buffet. Hotel We arrived at 2pm and the room was not ready until 5pm, our room was 402 and one of the superior types, our curtains were being re-hung or something. Everything was there except bathrobes, we only ever got 1, but we didn't care as the whole Rome experience took over any minor niggles. Use of the safe will cost 5 euros, there are tea and coffee facilities in the room - the room was as the website in every detail, plenty of space and storage. Sights Your sight seeing once out of the door, the quickest route into the city is via the nearby bridge by the Castille St Angelo (10 mins), from here you can walk forever finding diferent small streets and old building with places to eat or drink - theres no end. We pre-booked the collesium - this let us walk up to the desk and avoid the 45 minute queue (11am), we also pre-booked a vatican tour, again we walked right in while the line of 900mts of people queued (11am). After all of the walking the sight seeing buses are a good rest and alow you to see where things are. Rome is an easy city to get round and live with.

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful place to be”
Reviews.Author: hanban10
Reviews.Content: I can hardly fault this beautiful hotel. it's location is perfect. not in the hustle and bustle of the centre but you still felt in the heart of it all right next to the river which we had the pleasure of crossing each day and really getting to take it the wonderful views. it is also a 1 min walk to a bus stop where there is a bus to just about anywhere you want to get to and at the end of a long day of walking it was brilliant to hop on a bus.it is also within walking distance to all the main attractions. we even walked to the trev fountain at night it was so close. the area around is friendly and you felt safe compared to other areas we visited. the hotel itself is nearly perfect. the reception staff were always happy to help and were very friendly. there were 3 of us travelling myself (18), my mum,my grandma and we shared a triple room on the fourth floor that was clean, spacious and had a wonderful sunny feel. the breakfast was the best i have ever had. there is tremendous variety from cake and champagne to omlettes and tea and the room was spectacular. the roof top garden was beautiful and had an awesome view to st peters basillica. the only slightly negative points are that the lift doesnt go to the roof so it wouldnt be good for people with disabilities as they wouldn't be able to get to breakfast, and also the wifi didnt reach the 4th floor so in order to use it i had to sit in the lounge but it was a lovely lounge at that. and there is some traffic noise at night. all in all my trip to rome was amazing and this was made more special by this wonderful hotel and would reccommend it to anyone and will definatly be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jagster000
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a long weekend with my husband in March and stayed at Hotel Isa. We upgraded to a Superior Room (room 210) based on reviews about small rooms. The room was very spacious and clean. Our only moan about our room was it felt so new and modern that it had a "cold" feeling to it and needed some cosy touches. Having said that we were rarely in our room and so was perfect for us. Other reviews are right in that you do not get tea/coffee facilities so if you do like a brew in your room, take a travel kettle. The hotel's best feature is the rooftop terrace. We had champagne breakfast each morning which offered the usual pastries, cereals, omelettes made by the chef. It is fairly ideally located, however the local piazza was undergoing renovation so we felt the local area rather quiet. If you like evening/night time drink then you may want to stay near Travestere or Piazza Navona but I would imagine these places being quite busy in the tourist season. We did so much walking so bring comfy shoes and a guide book as there is so much to see and do. All in all no complaints, but would probably stay a little more central next time. You could avoid a 50 euro cab/hotel shuttle from the airport by catching a bus to Agnigna metro/bus station (the last stop on the bus). From Agnigna you can catch the metro ("A" line) to Lepanto which is a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. You can purchase metro/bus tickets for a couple of Euros from machines at the stations.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Masha0429
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and we loved it. Great location, walking distance from just about everything and very close to the Metro station. Nice room, modern bathroom. Clean. Friendly staff. Free buffet breakfast 7 AM - 10:30 AM. Would totally recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great superior rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Ramsrud
Reviews.Content: It's a nice and trendy hotel, the location is perfect. A short walk away frome verything that's worth a look. Staff at frontdesk was very friendly, but the rest of the staff spoke poor english. We ordered a superior room, but first got placed in a standard room. The standard room is so small you have to go out to the hallway to change your mind, but the superior room was magnificant. Big and cozy. Also the breakfast was good and the rooftop-restaurant reallt romantic, you can se the Vatican from there. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: quesitamama
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel Isa. The service couldn't have been better. The room was spacious and totally comfortable. We faced the sort of airway inside the hotel, it was quiet and very clean. Housekeeping here does a great job. The breakfast in the morning was a good start for the day. Mimo (working in the restaurant it seems all day) is very sweet, and at night we'd go up to the restaurant for a glass of wine, and Willie couldn't have been nicer. We didn't try the dinner; it seemed a bit pricey, but the view from the rooftop is really nice. I actually liked the location; next time I might stay in the Trastevere neighborhood (everyone seems to recommend staying there, and it is nice and closer to everything), but this was within walking distance to almost everything (I walk a lot though). The metro isn't too far from The Isa as well, and is extremely efficient. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “think twice- read this first!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravellots2
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at hotel Isa in mid October and it was not without fault.I had concerns about the hotel at booking so I had Expedia phone to ensure all rooms had been remodeled and Stephano assured Expedia that "all rooms were remodeled" so we kept our reservation. Upon arrival our bags were left in the lobby all day which made me nervous and up[on return to the hotel later in the evening we found our room decor as ancient as the ruins of the colliseum only Motel 6 style! TO full of spirits to care we waited till morning to complain and we were told the manager was in meetings all day. I had noticed a man thruout the hotel conferring with various employees and surmised he was the manager and low and behold here he comes thru the lobby as we are complaining. When I approached him he said he was "kind of " the manager and proceeded to assist us claiming our room was redone less than 4 yrs. ago.After much insult to my intelligence he told the desk preson to give us a room on the third floor...OMG if you can get a room on the third floor its all good! Its like flea bag V.S. four star appropriate plus ... but beware room is typical euro tiny ( with ample walking room surrounding the bed and lots of storage)but very very retro modern chic redone with top notch materials. The views on the roof are nice but the food was only barely edible. The positives are the manager gave us a very nice bottle of champange nicely decorated with a kind note upon arrival to our room that evening, the location was excellent as long as you are in good shape... and away from louder touristy spots which affords feeling more like you are going home at night rather than a tourist, good wine bar/ restaurant one block away... dont remember the name but when you leave the hotel go out and take a right on the first street and its on the right one block down with a corner location. It has big curb appeal with fancy iron gates. They have dinners with fixed prices that are splurge affordable. I would stay here again if in a remodeled room as long as I liked the location and ambience of the remodeled sectors and we actually had the most fun in Rome on this Italy tour!!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Chantal91
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Isa was absolutely the best choice we could make! Delightful design hotel, superbly located. We had a charming very quiet family appartment with two rooms, two bathrooms and a separate entrance. Our children were thrilled by their room with one wall fully mirrored. On the roof there's a beautiful roof terrace with restaurant, looking over St. Peters. The chef de cuisine and all the staff were so nice and friendly! Staying 3 nights, the hotel even offers a free-of-charge buffet dinner at the roof restaurant. Location is superb, great shopping is around the corner and all the sightseeing can be done on foot. We definitely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Away from the main tourist area”
Reviews.Author: nevertooold53
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located very close to the Vatican, offered very quiet rooms. The first one we were assigned was postage stamp, but we asked to move to a larger room (510) and it was much more comfortable. Housekeeping staff works hard to keep the room clean. Most of the front desk staff members (except Stefano) were very helpful. This was especially true of Fabio, who gave us good advice on restaurants and made reservations for us as well. The hotel has free wi-fi service in the downstairs lounge, but several times it was out of order. No one seemed excited about re-booting the system or finding out what the problem was. There is a very bountiful breakfast on the roof terrace, and most mornings Memmo (the chef) cooks omelets to your order. The terrace is open for dinner 6 nights a week, but we didn't try it. The safe in the room is of a fairly reasonable size, but it's not possible to program in a combination. Rather, you get a key from the front desk and we were warned to turn it in each time we left the hotel because it costs 150 Euros to replace. This didn't seem like very good security to us!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent little quiet hotel. Aims to please and it does.”
Reviews.Author: JazzDoc
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Isa on Via Cicerone 39 is a delightful small hotel with a very helpful and courteous staff. It is a short 15 minute walk to the vatican, and just a little farther the other way to The Spanish Steps and Trivoli Fountain. We stayed October 10 and 11, 2009. We found it delightful. Breakfast and dinner on the quaint patio on top of the hotel was wonderful. The staff were courteous and helpful. Magnifico Fabio (on the front desk), you are the best. All I can say is, a wonderful stay, Phillip Arrivaderci. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LilyfromSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a few nights and it was absolutely great. The hotel is in a nice location close to the Vatican area. The staff are polite and helpful and the hotel is clean and quite nice. I had a single room and it was reasonable in size, but a bit small maybe. The room was very clean and all my stay was quite happy. The highlight of this hotel is the breakfast. The breakfast is served on the roof with a view of the Vatican and the most amazing spread you can imagine. It was by far the best breakfast of all the hotels during my travels around Italy and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. The room was quite reasonably prices when booked early, and I will definitely be returning to this hotel on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Isa was a good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Sparty1970
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to stay in a hotel that was within walking distance to the Vatican. The Hotel Isa was a good choice. We were able to Email them that we needed to be picked up at the airport upon our arrival - no problem. We got the corner room on the 5th floor (Room 504). What a treat - Not one but two balconies. The room was always cleaned as you would expect and the entire staff was helpful and friendly. Don't miss the breakfast each morning on the roof terrace. The chef was a real pro and couldn't do enough to please you. The view of the top of St. Peter's from there was pretty neat. We took a all-day side trip to the Tuscany - wine-country (we highly recommend doing that). If you go to the Vatican, take a guided tour - it also included St. Peter's. Bring comfortable walking shoes and just appreciate everything you see, do, eat, drink and all the gracious Italians you meet. Italy is truly "Multi-Benne".

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a few days”
Reviews.Author: olderhappirr
Reviews.Content: Willie at the roof garden is an especially attentive, nice person! Roof garden also a great place to eat.. Other good places to eat within short walk. . Hotel In walking distance to Vatican, and St. Angelo castle and Villa Borghese. Internet worked in lobby but not in our room on 3rd floor. More expensive than we wished so we moved.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: gsdc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Isa is a three star hotel with delusions of being a four star. The Lobby is very attractive and modern and rooms on the second floor have been renovated. Problem is that they either ran out of money or are slow in doing rest of hotel. Rest of rooms look like early 60's Red Roof Inn. We booked six months in advance but were given a closet sized room. It was on the second, renovated floor but it was tiny, even my European standards. We were assured that we could change rooms on the second day but when we checked we were told there was nothing other than an old style room on the 3rd floor with three single beds! Mario assured us that we would receive an extra special room on the 3rd night. Guess what - it never happened! The rooftop terrace does have a wonderful view of St. Peter's and the restaurant staff could not have been nicer but even up there it could do with a little remodeling. Location was a bit of a walk to things but certainly doable. If you book here, be very careful to request a room on the second floor - any room other than Room 203!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Except for smelling like Poo...”
Reviews.Author: MarkE007
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I just came from Greece and Hotel Isa was a great value with a pretty good location (with a nice, cheap, italian restaurant around the corner). Just get ready to walk a lot. Amazing service, good size rooms (compared to the rest of europe), friendly staff also no problems with english. HOWEVER... We stayed there 4 nights and we didn't nail the stench down until the 3rd night but there is a definite air of sewage in the Hotel. It wasn't on the street outside, but inside the hotel, especially in our TWO rooms we stayed in (one on the first floor, another on the 5th). We wouldn't mind staying there again next time if it wasn't for the stench.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but didn't love location”
Reviews.Author: Jennall
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations given the 4 stars on hotels.com and the price. But we were a bit disappointed. The lobby is very nice; the rooms are small and decent. Not too much to write about the rooms besides just small! One huge positive is the breakfast and rooftop terrace. The food is very good and the views of St. Peter's are really great. The chef on the top floor is very friendly and helpful as well. We were disappointed in the location...we spent most every night in the city center near Piazza Navona, Pantheon, etc and wish we would have stayed closer to there instead of having to cross the river every night to head back to Hotel Isa. Although it is on the same side of the river as the Vatican, it is still a 20 minute walk to there. We did use the Metro (there is a stop about 4 blocks from Isa) to get to the Colosseum and did use the bus one night to get to Trastevere. In general, nice hotel but would not stay again because of location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely stay at Isa!”
Reviews.Author: Malena55
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Isa for three nights and were very satisfied. We took exclusive room with jacuzzi. Room is decorated in a modern way, very spacious, clean with huge plasma television with large number of Sky programs. Bathroom is great! When the windows are open you can hear some noise from the Via Cicerone below, but when you close them there is no problem. The only downside is the noise from the pluming that occurred 2 times and slight odor from the air conditioning. Breakfast is served on the roof terrace with lovely view on St. Peter's Basilica. Breakfast buffet is very good..certainly try omlett prepared just for you by the chef. Every day except Sunday the dinner is served on the roof terrace as well. I didn't particularly liked the side dishes that are served in a buffet - to salty for my taste. For the main meal you can choose from meat or fish, and the chef prepares it in front of you. All of the staff is very friendly. One of the main advantages of this hotel is its location.. very close to Castel Sant Angelo and Vatican, and when you cross the river Tiber the other main Rome amenities are in a walking distance too.. we managed to see all main attractions on foot. We had great stay at hotel Isa and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, spacious family room, good value”
Reviews.Author: Tonia_R
Reviews.Content: We arrived quite late, the hotel having arranged a good airport transfer with a nice driver who came in a huge SPV thing and whisked us into Rome in 30 mins from FCO. Check-in was quick and the staff efficient and friendly. Our family room was a 2 bed suite basically, both with large en-suite bathrooms, my only minor disappointment was that I booked about 4 months in advance and asked on several occasions for the modernised family room and we got the old school one, but actually it was fine, and had a more classical Italian feel anyway. AC was ice cold luckily as 40deg most days! Breakfast on the roof terrace was as expected, plentiful, included in the price AND with stunning views. Free interrnet use on the ground floor was a perfect addition too. The hotel has a lift but a few steps lead up to it. Its truly a beautiful old building that has been carefully modernised. Walkable to the river and the centre in 10/15 mins, there is no restaurant onsite but good ones locally. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: cinzian
Reviews.Content: Great location--very comfortable walk to Lepanto metro stop as well as Vatican, Pza Navona, etc. Just outside of the overrun tourist area, which made it very pleasant. Loved the breakfast buffet on the terrace--like a wedding breakfast. Room was great--normal size for Europe but with a running shelf alongside the walls to place stuff--providing more surfaces than you get at typical American hotels. Strong air conditioning and ventilation. Didn't quite get the ironing board thing, but I didn't bother to ask. Reception was helpful. We called America using an 800 number calling card. For Italy, all calls (brief) from the room phone were not more than 1 Euro. The great find for us was a Sicilian gelateria and eatery with arancine--wow. Located a few blocks away on Via Cicerone on the way to the Lepanto metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Isa”
Reviews.Author: Arbet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 days at this hotel pre-cruise. We were very satisfied with this hotel. We booked a superior deluxe room. The room we were given was on the fifth floor and was clean and spacious -- in fact, it is the largest room I've ever stayed at during my many trips to Europe. Everyone we encountered there -- the receptionists, the maid, the workers at the buffet -- were very friendly and efficient. We loved the location -- while not in the middle of the tourist area, it was a 10 minute walk to the Piazza Navona, and near a very lively avenue where the locals hang out at night for dinner, gelato, or a stroll. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who has plans to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Chic”
Reviews.Author: jenxie
Reviews.Content: Air condtioning saved our lives as hot hot hot. Small room but adequate - the lift worked- breakfast was excellent. Quiet location but good for Vatican and Piazza Navona. Do get them to have a taxi to pick you up if you are not catching the train - we have been caught out before - 50 euros. Excellent meal on the roof terrace - not open Saturdays.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: adabrown
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the Isa Hotel on our recent trip through Italy. It was clean, very new, and very comfortable. The location was perfect - just outside the really crazy tourist area, but close enough to walk to almost everything. The windows blocked out the light and most of the noise - I'm a very light sleeper and was satisfied with it. The bathroom was very modern, and the room had ample space for luggage, etc. The staff spoke English and were sufficiently helpful. There was a computer in the lobby which was free to use, which was really nice. The staff even printed out a reservation for a tour for us. The breakfast buffet had a huge variety to choose from and made your coffee/espresso/cappucino to order. LOVED the freshly squeezed OJ! We booked our hotel using reviews from TripAdvisor - they were pretty acurate, and the pictures from the website were true. Overall this was a great hotel - I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Italian hospitality in a beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: wife-o-chris
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the hotel and were really glad we had chosen it, there were so many to chose from in Rome. The front desk staff was super helpful, the maids were really nice and the staff at the rooftop terrace was over the top great, especially the chef who seems to work constantly! The breakfast was a real crowd pleaser for our our group (5 adults) because once we got on the street we walked and explored all day. The rooftop is a bar in the evening and it was the perfect place to meet up and regroup while overlooking the dome of St Peters. We would stay there again, it was great to be on that side of the river rather than in the busy heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel I would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Kenny79
Reviews.Content: When we arrived our room was not ready and we were asked to come back in an hour to check in. We came back and were given the key to our room. The housekeeping staff seem to be the only ones allowed to use the lift during the day, so we had to drag our case up 3 flights of stairs, only to find that our room had not yet been cleaned. So back down the stairs to reception who made no apology and asked us to come back in another hour. The pictures on the hotel website are very misleading, as only 2 out of the 5 floors have been renovated and our room was very very run down. We were woken up at 6.30am every morning by constant chatter of housekeeping staff. The reception staff weren't rude but made no effort to be friendly or helpful. No advise was given on times or locations for breakfast, dinner or the bar, you simply had to work this out for yourself. This hotel was extremely overpriced. Not to be recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Really good city centre hotel- Friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: teemoretraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice city centre hotel. Its location is perfect 5 mins from the vatican. The breakfast is brillant will keep you going until dinner. The staff were very friendly and always willing to help and chat. The room was not quite what I expected from the website but they seem to be doing up the hotel floor by floor. The decor in my room was a bit dated and bissare but it was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “expect what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: xplrmor
Reviews.Content: great location. rome is very walkable and fun to tour on foot. having isa as a base worked out well. it seemed to be in the more quite part of rome, separated from the drones of tourists and obnoxious middleschoolers with mullets. when we booked this hotel, and booked the cheapest room, i did not expect to get the room which is shown on the website, nor did we get the room that was on the website. what we did get was a nice, spacious room, which was clean, comfortable and safe. my only complaint are that the doors and walls are thin and would be dreadful if you had noisey people on your floor. the staff was friendly and the rooftop was a nice place to relax with a drink and overlook st. peters. bottom line, dont be dissappointed if you book the cheapest room and you dont get whats on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Very well placed hotel - super breakfast but in cold weather wear a coat!”
Reviews.Author: 50scoupleManchester
Reviews.Content: The rooms in Hotel Isa (3 couples - 1 room on 2nd floor and 2 rooms on 3rd floor) were quite adequate. We did not have a bath in these rooms and after walking all day around Rome it would - on reflection - have been nice to have a soak. The breakfast was lovely - so much cake!! Freshly squeezed orange juice and fresh coffee from the counter. Hot stuff not quite so good but great selection of cheeses, cold meats, fruit, yoghurts etc.. All the dining is on the roof terrace which has thick canvass to protect you from elements, however it was very cold (mid Feb) and we needed double layers to go and eat breakfast. We had a complimentary dinner one evening and having been slightly disappointed at the buffet bar, the 'cooked to your liking' steak or fish was fantastic (even if we did get a bit smoked out!! In summer this would not be a problem as the canvass would presumable be lifted) In terms of location - this is the vatican side of the river - 5m from Castel San Angelo and 10m from St Peter's (which you can see from roof terrace but not our rooms which were either a courtyard or street view) We love walking so very happy to cross river each day to see all other key sights. Metro not too far a walk either if you decide on that...

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: machapuchare
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! We absoluetely enjoyed our stay! We had booked an online special and therefore only got one of the smaller rooms and probably not yet renovated rooms - but still had a great time. The location is perfect! It is only a 5 min walk to Vatikan! But also most of the other attractions can be visited by foot. A Metro (Underground) station is available 5 min away and the hop on hop off sighseeing busses stop at the Vatikan. The staff has been very very friendly and helpful (which is not that normal o Rome as we had to find out in restaurants etc.). Another highlight is the breakfast at the roof top terrace! Stunning views while enjoying a very nice breakfast buffet! If it´s Rome again - it´s gonna be Hotel Isa again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved Hotel Isa”
Reviews.Author: M3lyssa
Reviews.Content: This hotel came highly recommended from a very good friend. Isa is within walking distance of the Vatican, The Spanish Steps and The Trevi Fountain. The highlight of our stay was the amazing breakfast up on the roof. We had a tiny room on the first floor, with a "view" of a courtyard. While the view wasn't anything to write home about the tiny room was plently big for the two of us and the service was amazing. We heard that there are several larger rooms and rooms with city views as well. We look forward to another trip to Roma and Isa.

Reviews.Title: “a good find!”
Reviews.Author: LuciaAWT
Reviews.Content: The honeymoon suite is gorgeous. Looks like it's just been redone, with a jacuzzi and big screen TV. The staff was very helpful, they even lent us a power converter when mine didn't work. Great location, right in the heart of the city, and you can walk to many of the historical landmarks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Isa”
Reviews.Author: ny7chic
Reviews.Content: I went to Hotel Isa for 2 nights on the second stop of my Italian honeymoon. Our room, room 210, was beautiful, very modern with an amazing shower, small balcony and ample storage space. They even provided bath robes and slippers which were a nice touch. We actually enjoyed our room there better than the city itself! The location was in walking distance in many of the city's attractions. If you like shopping, the hotel was also a few blocks within many shops. The buffet breakfast was great with ample variety of cold and hot foods. We also tried the dinner buffet which was 20 Euro each, not including drinks. Dinner had a selection of salads and vegetables, then for your entree you could have steak, fish or shrimp freshly sauteed by a French chef. Dessert was lacking since there was fruit only. The front desk was very helpful I even forgot my COACH purse there after we left, and once we got to Positano, the hotel's front desk called the people at Hotel Isa. They found my purse for me and held it until someone could pick it up for me. This proves their staff, especially housekeeping, are honest for not deciding to keep a designer purse after finding it. I would recommend this hotel if you find yourself in Rome. However, if deciding between major foreign cities, go to Barcelona or Madrid instead. But that is another story!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Roof Terrace”
Reviews.Author: kathmcc
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. Immaculate hotel with a stunning roof terrace for enjoying breakfast and pre-dinner drinks. The staff at the hotel, especially Fabio and Willy were wonderfully welcoming and really looked after us during our weekend break. The hotel is in an ideal location, with scenic walks to the historical centre, the vatican and collesium (a little further, but lovely walk). I would highly recommend the Hotel Isa.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ws1983
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Isa. The room was a little small though I think there are larger ones. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The breakfast was wonderful and scenic from the rooftop of the hotel. Dinner was also good. We had a good time at the Hotel Isa.

Reviews.Title: “A 3 star hotel selling it self as a 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: analmeida
Reviews.Content: The hotel is expensive. The room was very noisy, at about 6.30 a.m was impossible to sleep becouse the breakfast room was right above our room. We´ve stayed in a superior room, and we never understood why it was called a "superior room". More serious, we booked a room in a 4 star hotel, and we´ve stayed in a 3 star hotel. This is intolerable. Well, not everything was bed, the breakfast was good, in a terrace, with a lovely view of the Vaticane.

Reviews.Title: “position a”
Reviews.Author: irishtraveller1980
Reviews.Content: position A could not have been any better situated right between new and old town, accomadation clean and better

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if location is important to you...........”
Reviews.Author: BOO-CM
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine but our least favorite of the three hotels we stayed at while in Italy. It also was the most expensive of the three. The room was decorated modestly and the bathroom although tidy and clean did not have good water pressure in the shower. The water never seemed to get hot enough either which would have been nice since it was quite chilly ;-(. The location was great however. Right in the heart of the city and a 20 minute walk to the Spanish Steps or the Vatican. A good pizza by the slice place and gelato store across the street on the main road was a nice find though. Would stay here again but ,I would check the water pressure in my room before unpacking!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JMR85
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise! The location was excellent, within walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go. The breakfast terrace was lovely and the service could not have been better. We had a triple and it had plenty of room. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Rome”
Reviews.Author: gingerdi
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to stay at the Hotel Isa for 2 nights in October. It was a great hotel, great location, very clean rooms (a bit small) and staff was most helpful. The breakfast buffet is on the rooftop. It is a great view, the food was wonderful and the chef very entertaining. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “deceived by good reviews of this hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Mr. MJB
Reviews.Content: Had read several good Trip Advisor reviews of this hotel and decided to follow their advice and book for a 5 night visit with my wife. We were not as impressed as we expected to be. The first room we were shown on the 3rd floor (310) was mock Roman villa shabby chic with the emphasis on shabby most of which was not deliberate. Additionally there was hardly any storage apart from a small wardrobe with a hole cut in the floor for longer items and no drawers or closed cupboards - inadequate for five nights in a sophisticated city. To be fair to the hotel when we asked if another room was available they immediately found us another on the re-furbished 2nd Floor at the same price and stated that room 310 was not one of those that was usually complained about! Room 204 was much improved with modern fittings and excellent bathroom. However it was facing the street and therefore very noisy. This is a very expensive hotel considering its star rating and facilities. Our next trip includes a stay at a Mandarin Oriental, which is less expensive surprisingly. Our specific concerns apart from cost which may be down to the prevailing market in Rome, were:- we had to request Bathrobes and slippers which were supposed to be available, we had no price list for the mini bar, broken window in our bedroom, noisy main road location, very limited breakfast choice unless you have a taste for cold scrambled eggs and sausages or hard boiled eggs floating in water, disinterested staff ( although Fatima, our room attendant was very good and it was obvious when it was her day off!) No hooks for bathrobes so these were place daily on top of the towel rail and it was necessary to climb on the bath to retrieve them, lift often in use by delivery staff to the breakfast terrace or decorators and therefore not always available to guests. No catering facilities apart from breakfast and not even tea or coffee making facilities in the room. Some reception staff suddenly found English difficult to understand if a problem they were asked to deal with became too demanding. Our example was trying to get a taxi booked to take us to the train station but during the time that took of nearly 40 minutes there were several others who were raising problems such as a superior room they had booked weeks before had been double booked and no longer available, a guest whose key would not work (again) and a couple who had booked the hotels airport shuttle getting agitated as it had not turned up at the agreed time. Eventually I hailed a taxi myself outside although it is illegal in Rome for taxi drivers to stop for fares but as the receptionist herself stated "this is Italy, so no comment" The positive aspect of the hotel is its position 10 minutes walking from The Vatican and castle and near to Cavour bridge to cross the river. It is quite possible to walk to The Colloseum in around 30 minutes, the Trevi Fountain in 20 minutes and 15 minutes to Spanish Steps. A word of warning to visitors to Rome for the first time, as we were. It is very easy to be ripped off by Taxi Drivers and in Restaurants. We were quoted 25 Euros from Termini Station to the Hotel, which we accepted. The return trip took far longer due to traffic conditions but was only 15 Euros - why? We stopped for coffee and a pastry at a cafe approaching Vatican City. Coffee was said to be 1.50 Euros on a list over the counter and Gateaux 5 Euros - total Euros13 .We were asked if we would like to sit down and they would bring it outside to us. The bill came to 34 Euros. 21 Euros was because we had decided to eat on the premises and a service charge for waiter service. Beware too of Romans bearing gifts in Restaurants. The "complimentary" bread or Bruscetta or vegetables they so charmingly serve with the compliments of the chef are anything but complimentary and can add significantly to the bill. We have learned that this practise has been outlawed by the Italian Government but still persists everywhere, and we don't complain do we because we are not comfortable with the language nor like to make a scene Would not use the Isa again but the sights ( but not sounds - the worst traffic in Europe?) of Rome are wonderful and the City is well worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Great find...would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Rocky50
Reviews.Content: We Arrived in late September and checked-out in early October 2007. We were also referred to this hotel as a second choice by our travel office and was very satisfied with the accomodations and location. Though there was a mix up by our agent in reserving the room on the first night, Isa Hotel staff immediately provided alternative lodging for that night that provided an opportunity to compare comparable "three star accomodations". After conferring with other travelers while in Rome, we concluded that the Isa was a great find due to: - Location. Just steps away from the Vatican, St. Peter's Basilica and main shopping areas. Also down the street from a friendly Trattoria serving great food. - Size of the room. We had room 310 and noted the bathroom was about more than twice the size of the other hotel from the first night. - Breakfast buffet. A fully staffed outdoor/indoor roof top dining area with a clear view of St. Peter's Dome. - Near public transportation. Major bus stop at the end of the road and within walking distance to the Metro. - Friendly staff. Seem that most of the staff spoke English and were helpful in providing basic directions and recommendations. I will definitely stay here again and quickly refer this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good, But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: timinvests4u
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Isa Hotel from Sept. 20-23. Overall it was a good stay, but not great. We arrived about 7:00 pm. First, the lift was very small, and there is no help in handling the bags from the front desk to the room. Second, the room they put us in was a tiny room with a hall as the sleeping area. There were two beds butted end to end, separated by a counter top (or stationary night stand). I had emailed the hotel before and asked them for a nice room, since we were celebrating our 25th anniversary. Needless to say, this arrangement did not suit the request or what we paid for. I went to the front desk and told them of the room problem. They said they were sorry, but they were full and they would move us the next day, to a room with a king bed. They offered no compensation or anything else for our inconvience, other than a "sorry". They did move us the next day, but the room was only a little bigger and the "king bed" was two beds pushed together. The small balcony looked into the inside of the building, which was nothing more than four walls and windows. The hotel was in a good location, about a 10 minute walk to the Vatican and 10 minutes to Pizza Navona. The breakfast area is nicely done and the breakfast was better than most of the breakfasts offered in other hotels that we stayed at in Europe (does not compare to the full breakfast buffets offered in other non-European countries). The eggs were only warm at best and they were runny most of the time. As I stated before, good stay, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: debbies_mum
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and were very pleased with the hotel, situated within walking distance from the Vatican. Our room on the 5th floor was large and had a little terrace overlooking the road, very nice to sit there in the sun in the late afternoon and watch the scene below. The bathroom was clean and spacious, although more hot air came from the split flex on the hairdryer than out of the nozzle! The breakfast terrace had wonderful views of central Rome. We could have done without the late-night noise from the wedding party going on in the breakfast terrace area on the 6th floor, followed by the chairs and tables being dragged back into position by the staff after the last noisy guests had shouted their way out of the hotel, but hey. It stopped eventually. Worst bit: not being able to get anything to eat and drink at all in the hotel after breakfast hours. There were two very stylish lounges in the hotel, recently refurbished and all done in black and white. Hidden away in the back of one of them is a superb cloakroom. Check it out. Overall it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler60614
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to many sights. The lobby is in beautiful condition and the breakfast terrace is beautiful. The rooms are nice, a little small. Make sure to ask for a room not on the street side because it might be loud. Really a great value for Rome and was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “lovely breakfast terrace”
Reviews.Author: TA_member_wp
Reviews.Content: We have decided to book this hotel after reading reviews from this website. We stayed there for 5 nights and I have to say we did enjoy our stay a lot. The breakfast terrace was fantastic, with great view on the roof. We stayed on the 4th floor and our room was quite big and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only downside was the lift which sometimes did not work. Unfortunately, that happened twice during our stay but other things made up for it. I would also like to recommend a restaurant nearby called San Marco, via Tacito, which was always busy with locals and tourists. The price was reasonable and food was excellent. The hotel is located near the Vatican and you can walk to other attractions on the other side of the river.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: lebanese-cutie
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel! at first we were thrown off at the reception it looked a little torn down and old but they were just redecorating once you get upstairs the hallways are very nicely decorated and the rooms are HUGE!!! i couldn't believe it so much space and satelite tv! not that you care for tv but during breaks it was nice to listen to english television! Also i found the maids cleaned better then any of the other maids we've had at previous hotels! it was also close to everything we had an easy time to walk to all the nice sites and if we couldnt walk there was a metro close enough too us and bus stop close by also! i will deff be recomending this hotel to everyone! and will be coming back to it for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeshireWombat
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be perfect for our 4 day stay in Rome. The staff were all friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and had everything we needed, the air conditioning was lovely to come back to after a busy days sight-seeing, and the breakfast buffet on the roof terrace was a sensational way to start each day. The best thing for us was the location - easy walking distance to the Vatican, Piazza Navona, and pleanty of shops and restaurants. You could walk to the Colloseum and Forum area, but given the heat we wanted to conserve our energy for when we got there, and it was easy (and fairly cheap) to get the bus there from the nearby Piazza Cavour.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem in the heart of Rome !!!”
Reviews.Author: CarpeDiem1979
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the excellent reviews I read on the internet. Some older reviews lamented on the old, dingy rooms on the lower floors, however, all floors appear to be updated now and work was going on in the lobby while we were there. Our room on the 4th floor was very small, but also very clean, modern and comfortable. The bathroom was very clean and stylish as well and it sure was nice to turn on the air conditioner after a long day out in the sun. The hotel also had wireless internet in the rooms for the bargain price of 1 euro per hour and a fabulous terrace on the rooftop with lounge chairs AND a great view of the neighbourhood. The breakfast spread was incredible. Eggs of all sorts, frittata made with cheese and/or ham, fresh lunch meats, fresh fruit, cheese of all sorts, pastries, cakes, and of course cereal and milk (and I just know I am missing something). Excellent selection, excellent presentation and a very friendly staff. The 'bottomless' cappuccino and orange juice freshly squeezed on demand were also very nice touches. You could tell that the hotel goes out of their way to make this one of the best (if not THE best) breakfasts in Rome. We didn't pick up our rental car until after our 4 days in Rome were up...and we didn't need it. The hotel was within walking distance from the Vatican, the old historic center (Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain etc) and Villa Borghese. We took a taxi to the Colosseo early one morning to save time, but walked back after touring the Foro and Palatino. We absolutely will be returning to this hotel and will make sure our relatives and friends know about this great little gem we found. You will not be disappointed with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: aliceiscute
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Isa hotel....the reception area was under construction but it was not a major problem at all. Staff were very friendly and the breakfast on the terrace was wonderful....our room was on the 3rd floor and was small and basic. bathroom was good though and the air-conditioning was a welcome relief from the sweltering heat of rome. The location was perfect, 10 min walk to the vatican, 5 min to the metro and surrounded by great shops and restaurants. Try the Portofino cafe around the corner in the piazza cavour...fantastic coffee and desserts, a good place to people watch... Considering the location and convenience we couldn't ask for more.....there is so much to see in roma that you don't spend much time in the room anyway so it didn't matter that it was teeny tiny....enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel at an accepable price for Rome”
Reviews.Author: KHBristol
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We arrived very late at night and there were no problems checking in. Our room, on the second floor, had been recently decorated and, although small, was perfect, with a lovely balcony. Bathroom, also very small, but very well fitted and modern. The breakfast buffet on the roof terrace was amazing - awesome selection of excellent quality food. Location is great - 5 mins walk to the Vatican, and a couple of mins walk to the nearest bridge to get you over to the other side of the city. No complaints from us!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: jyvais
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights there. Location: great. Via Cola di Renzo is a great place to do shopping. You won't find the Prada and Gucci but tons of nice shops at reasonable prices. The vatican is next door and you just cross one of the bridges to join the historic centre. Room: now all renovated. OK not with the best taste (a bit daggy-kitch) but at least all new and fresh bed and furniture. Bathroom: amazing. Ours was almost the size of the room, all marble, roman bath type shower and all amenities you can expect. Breakfast: The reason to go there ! On the roof terrasse with view over the coupole of St Peter basilique. Fantastique buffet and fresh coffee and juice made in front of you by the barrista. Honnestly better than many 4 or 5 star hotels I have been to. All this for 150 Euros per night. A great address !

Reviews.Title: “Can't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Armanino
Reviews.Content: My husband and grown daughters had a delightful stay, with more than helpful staff. We arrived very late without luggage, the staff immediately provided us with tooth paste, brushes etc. In the morning they tried to locate our luggage so we were able to go see the sites of Roma. The rooms are clean, bathrooms super, food for breakfast -delicious (again very nice staff). Three cheers for location, property, price and STAFF. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Under-rated. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Brunlea
Reviews.Content: Spent a long time deciding which hotel to go to for a four night break & in the end decided to return to the Isa which we had used many years ago in different circumstances. The primary reason was its location - because it is situated on the bend in the river it is an easy walk to the Vatican, the Spanish Steps, Piazza Nuava and Corso di Rienza (shopping street). It is also very well placed for the Metro and buses with a major bus interchange a hundred yards away. Local restaurants are good and significantly cheaper than the main tourist areas. The Hotel itself is comfortable with helpful staff. Rooms are individually decorated and bathrooms excellent. Breakfast is well above the roman norm and is eaten on the roof (thankfully under a cover with transparent walls in mid-winter) with views to St Peter's. The bath water could do with being a bit hotter but otherwise I have no criticisms and will certainly use it next time I go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “try the honeymoon suite!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Rome after a long, delayed flight and were shown to the honeymoon suite. bright, natural light, huge showers, sunken bath. just the ticket!!! The mini bar was nicely stocked and the staff were friendly enough to point us in the best direction for food. what with a fantastic location, I loved Isa.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Rome for our 3rd wedding anniversary. Rome is absolutely beautiful and we plan to return again this year. However, we would not stay in the Isa again. We were both very disappointed. Were appointed a dark and dingy small room on the 2nd floor. The sink and bath were badly marked with the leaking taps and the carpets & decor was very shabby. Our room looked out into what they called a courtyard, but what I would describe as a tower of flats- which meant no natural light coming into the room. Buffet breakfast was poor in that unless you like cake or cooked meat for your breakfast you've had it! - and the bread rolls kept running out. No bar, mini-bar or any food served after breakfast. Sorry Isa - your location is excellent but your hotel is just not enough to encourage a repeat visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - pity about the room”
Reviews.Author: manc_19
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel over the internet through Alpharooms. Thought it was a good deal, £280 for 4 nights in a superior room. Overall the hotel was good, polite and helpful staff, good breakfast, clean rooms etc. The only thing that disappointed me was the size of our room. I travelled with my boyfriend so we booked a superior double, there was nothing superior about it! Plus, after seeing into the room nextdoor (which was huge, sofa and everything) we were even more put out. I liked this hotel, especially the breakfasts on the terrace, great views. The location is also fantastic - lots of great restaurants on your door step! Book this hotel, but don't go for a superior room, the extra 40 quid isn't worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Second floor = second class citizen”
Reviews.Author: Claudia72
Reviews.Content: At first we thought this hotel was lovely - nice lobby, breakfast etc. Unfortunately, like so many others, we wound up with a second floor room. This meant that although we paid the same price as guests on higher floors (we booked online) we got an unrenovated floor, tiny room, and......NO HOT WATER WHATSOEVER. We have three nights left at the Isa and despite our complaints to reception it seems as though we will have to go a week without hot showers. It is as if there are two different hotels in the same building, as we have seen what the other floors have to offer. Staff are more than happy to help until they find out that you are on the second floor, after which your requests are met with denial and stalling tactics. We feel powerless, and have spoken to other guests on our floor who feel the same. Don't stay at the Isa, it is not worth the risk of being on the second floor!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Isa - our FAVORITE!!”
Reviews.Author: JKL06
Reviews.Content: I adore this hotel - my boyfriend and I stay here every time we are in Rome. The location is great - right across the River Tiber, and a stone's throw from Vatican city! Our rooms are always large (by European standards; as an American, I appreciate this!) clean, and we have been lucky enough to have adorable balconies each time. The high ceilings, nice wood, and generously set out bathrooms are comfortable and make the room enjoyable to stay in. But the best part is the breakfast!! As Homer Simpson would say "mmmmmmmm," with appropriate happy drooling, which always sets me in a fabulous state! Served on the recently renovated roof, you can see the top of the Basilica, as you sit under a lemon tree and devour as much of the fantastic Italian food you can handle,(which is included in the price of your room), while they will make you a cappuccino if you wish. We usually don't have to eat again until 4 or so, which is perfect for getting ready for a long Italian dinner at one of the nearby charming restaurants. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Awful room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 nights at this hotel. The experience was all but pleasant. I arrived at the hotel in the late afternoon and was being put in a room on the second floor. It was more like a store room with no windows - dinky, dark and gloomy. It had an "open" bathroom with a WC and a shower stall both of the size of a tiny closet. Despite my relatively small frame, I was unable to turn around inside the WC or shower without hitting the walls. Breakfast was okay though it was shared by a lot of small bugs hovering over the food. I got a diarrhea on the second day.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: PaulHBelgium
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights. As requested, we got a quiet room at the back on 5th floor: no view, but good sized windows and even a little balcony. Room was a long thin 'L' shape, smaller than the square rooms at the front of the hotel, but we accepted that to be away room the noisy main street; however, it didn't have easy chairs or a sofa, so not good for much except sleeping in. Decor is modern and angular: lots of marble and smoked glass. Bathroom was well-appointed and had a great shower; bathrobes and slippers provided. Everything was clean, and stayed that way during our stay; toiletries and towels etc were changed regularly. Breakfast on the top floor terrace was really plentiful and in a lovely setting; only on the busiest days were the staff a little overwhelmed (took too long to replenish empty bread baskets etc). The lift is a bit erratic - not good if you are on the 5th floor! There is no satellite TV - mostly Italian channels. Situation is ideal for St Peter's and also not too far from north and west central Rome; bus and metro are close by. We enjoyed our stay, but personally, I found this hotel was not worth the € 170 per night we paid, though from what I have seen, this is actually not too expensive in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: lmlmlmjm
Reviews.Content: I would have to start with the fact that I asked this Hotel to send a car to pick my wife and I up at the airport as the flight was arriving at 11.30pm. The car never arrived. Despite 2 emails to confirm. On arrival we were put in a room on the second floor, because the lift was out of order. Terrible dingy room. Ask for a third floor room or above. I think they are improving the rooms from the roof down. We moved to the fourth floor the next day. Much better room. The breakfast was the most unimaginitive I have had on any city break. Frequently they ran out of bread, cereal bowls etc. This was every morning! There is no bar at the hotel and no food served after breakfast. Although the hotel was clean and in an excelent location for St. Peters and the Vatican City. I would not stay at the Hotel Isa again. And remember it's pronouced eesa.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky Isa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel in the last minute after having trouble with Due Torri (extra charges, etc). Was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. We had room 500 on the fifth floor for €150. The bathroom was very impressive for this price range in Rome big, cleanand new. The room needed a fresh coat of paint and somebody with a bit more esthetic sense, but it was quiet until the morning when some guest's kid strarted whining. Still the bed was wide and comfy and the French windows opened to a cute little balcony facing the internal courtyard. The best selling point of the hotel for us though was the roofterrace, where on two blue sky, sun-drenched Rome mornings we enjoyed great breakfasts--excellent capuccinos, fresh fruits, omellettes, parma ham, etc. with a full view of St Peter's dome. No better way to kick off you day in Rome! Location was a plus being close to p. Cavour, v. Cola de Rienzo, p. Navona, and the metro station. Staff were helpful when my girlfriend lost her passport and they directed us to the nearest police station and rang up the embassy to get info on replacement. All in all, good value for money in peak season Rome accomodation. Wouldn't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with my room - the room number was hanging off the door, the bathroom was dirty, the toilet seat was broken and it looked nothing like the rooms shown on the Internet. Whilst trying to get these issues resolved I was told that this was a standard room and to upgrade would cost an additional charge. I was offered another room but this was no better.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money!”
Reviews.Author: olivia2011
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel and will not choose to stay here again. After seeing the hotels’ website I assumed I’d get a room similar to those depicted, how wrong can you be!....The rooms on the 2nd floor look nothing like they do on the website. After having paid a fair amount for the room, I assumed I would get something half decent. On arrival I was allocated a room with a twin bed, when I had booked a double. The door number hanging off the room door was a sign of things to come!...If you are unlucky enough to end up on the 2nd floor the rooms are in serious need of updating and can only been described as a bit grubby and dirty. All the rooms are meant to be non smoking, but this rule is clearly not adhered too. Breakfast was due to finish at 10.30 each morning, however on arrival at 9.30 for breakfast, there was little food left and the stock was not replenished. The food that was available did not look particularly fresh either.

Reviews.Title: “great for the purpose”
Reviews.Author: sandyprime
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting a complete luxury hotel in rome, with decedant european furniture and architecture, this is not the place. rather, it reminded me of a very business friendly place. good size rooms, clean, modern, adequite service, great transportation to airport, great location. our price was $150E for a double and a little cheaper for single. the breakfast was great for european standards and we only stayed 2 nights and it was perfect. i would recommend this place. also, the location was perfect.
